20 2021-04-29 nausea Patient experienced syncope/fainting episode approx 15 mins after vaccination. Patient stood from ch... Read more
Close
Patient experienced syncope/fainting episode approx 15 mins after vaccination. Patient stood from chair and complained of nausea, asked for water. Legs buckled, patient fell to knees. Did not fall all the way to floor or experience head/body trauma. Patient was attended to by supervising pharmacist, and subsequently moved into chair with assistance. Pulse and respirations were normal, but patient was pale, diaphoretic, and complained of nausea and dizziness for another 15-20 minutes. No epinephrine or diphenhydramine was indicated or administered. Patient was observed until approximately 8:30pm, at which time he had made a full recovery. Patient left under his own power, and safely travelled to his home. Pharmacist called to check on patient and spoke with him twice (4/29, 9:50pm...4/30, 4:30pm). Patient reports feeling fine, no residual effects. Is eager to receive his second dose on 5/20/21.
20 2021-04-30 nausea, vomiting, flatulence Initial presentation Patient was in his usual state of good health until 4/19 when he received his f... Read more
Close
Initial presentation Patient was in his usual state of good health until 4/19 when he received his first dose of the Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine. Two hours after the injection he became nauseous and vomited multiple times. Overnight he experienced diffuse myalgia and suprapubic pain. He awoke the next day to a pustular rash on his chin, forehead, chest and back. The patient describes similar previous rashes that have resolved spontaneously. The next day he began to experience gross hematuria and presented to the ED with a temperature of 98.9, blood pressure of 100/69mmHg, heart rate of 110bpm, respiratory rate of 18 breaths per minute and an O2 saturation of 97% on room air. On examination, patient was ill-appearing with diffuse pustules on his face, chest and back, periorbital edema, and leukoplakia of the tongue and buccal mucosa. His abdomen was soft and tender to palpation in the suprapubic area and at both costovertebral angles. Hospital course In the ED the patient was found to have a metabolic acidosis of pH 7.33 with an anion gap of 16, lactate 2.6, neutrophilic leukocytosis (22k), acute renal insufficiency with a BUN of 45 and creatinine 3.81 (baseline is 0.76). The patient?s urine demonstrated packed RBCs and 5-10 WBCs. He was admitted to the medicine service for further management. On the medicine floor he was initially found to have rhabdomyolysis (CK 584), worsening renal failure (Creatinine 8), follicular conjunctivitis by skin biopsy, a low CD3/CD4 count (CD4 91, CD3 47, CD8 258) with normal complement, and bilateral tinnitus. CT A/P without contrast showed increased attenuation of renal pelves and ureters consistent with hemorrhage, but no renal stones or hydronephrosis was seen. The patient was treated with pulse dose 500mg IV Methylprednisilone for 3 days and then transitioned to 60mg Prednisone. The patient?s pustular rash and oral leukoplakia greatly improved while on pulse dose steroids, but his kidney function continued to decline (Creatinine rising from 8 to 11), and the patient?s bilateral tinnitus progressed to bilateral sensorineural deafness over 2 days. Bilateral hearing loss prompted an MRI of the brain which identified several punctate infarcts across multiple vascular territories in bilateral cortices and left cerebellum. The patient?s kidney function has continued to decline, with progressive hyperkalemia and hemodialysis was begun.
20 2021-04-30 nausea Fever of 100 F, whole body aches, nausea, chills, sweats, inability to sleep

Client reports having a history of sinus problems. Client denied getting vitals taken and any interventions offered, ie. crackers & water. Client left facility unassisted with a steady gait at 3pm.
20 2021-05-07 loss of appetite, vomiting, nausea Within 1 hour of the vaccination, patient developed headache (lasted 2-3 days), and 1 week of nausea... Read more
Close
Within 1 hour of the vaccination, patient developed headache (lasted 2-3 days), and 1 week of nausea, intermittent vomiting, extreme fatigue, generalized weakness. He had decreased oral intake for solids and liquids, up to 5-6 total episodes of emesis over the last week. He was seen in urgent care 5/5 and treated with Zofran. He had decreased urine output the next two days (~15 hours without voiding). And was seen in ED 5/7 and transferred to ICU for management of severe hyponatremia, though never developed seizures or neurologic abnormalities.
20 2021-05-07 nausea, vomiting worsening renal failure/kidney function continued to decline; gross hematuria; follicular conjunctiv... Read more
Close
worsening renal failure/kidney function continued to decline; gross hematuria; follicular conjunctivitis; a low CD3/CD4 count (CD4 91, CD347, CD8 258); a low CD3/CD4 count (CD4 91, CD347, CD8 258); The patient's unilateral tinnitus progressed to bilateral sensorineural deafness over 2 days; The patient's unilateral tinnitus progressed to bilateral sensorineural deafness over 2 days; pustular rash on his chin forehead, chest and back; nauseous; diffuse myalgia; vomited; suprapubic pain; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable other healthcare professional. A 20-year-old male patient first dose of received bnt162b2 (BNT162B2), intramuscular, administered in left arm on 19Apr2021, at the age of 20-years old, (Lot Number: EW0151) as SINGLE DOSE for covid-19 immunisation. The patient's medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. Prior to vaccination, the patient has not been diagnosed with COVID-19. It was reported that the patient was in his usual state of good health until 19Apr2021, when he received his first dose of the Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine. Two hours after the injection he became nauseous and vomited multiple times. Overnight he experienced diffuse myalgia and suprapubic pain. On 20Apr2021, he woke up the next day to a pustular rash on his chin, forehead, chest and back. The patient describes similar previous rashes that have resolved spontaneously. On21Apr2021, he began to experience gross hematuria and presented to the Emergency department. On the medicine floor he was initially found to have worsening renal failure, follicular conjunctivitis by skin biopsy, a low CD3/CD4 count (CD4 91, CD3 47, CD8 258) with normal complement, and bilateral tinnitus. The patient's unilateral tinnitus progressed to bilateral sensorineural deafness over 2 days. His kidney function continued to decline and hemodialysis was begun on 27Apr2021. His kidney function continued to decline on hemodialysis, becoming so he was transferred to the MICU for CRRT. The patient was hospitalized for 12 days due to the events, the events were also assessed as life-threathening. The patient been tested for COVID-19 post vaccination with unknown result. The outcome of the events was unknown. Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of the events. Information on Lot/Batch number was available. Additional information has been requested.

Color returned & pt. reported "feeling much better" within a few minutes. Pt was reassessed and released from care of Fire/EMS @ 10:15AM. 20 2021-05-26 vomiting blood, vomiting At approximately 12:30 PM on May 26, 2021, Pt. began vomiting while he was at school. Prior to vomi... Read more
Close
At approximately 12:30 PM on May 26, 2021, Pt. began vomiting while he was at school. Prior to vomiting, school staff reported that he seemed unwell (pt. is severely disabled and has very limited speech). The first episode of vomiting was followed by multiple (4-5) episodes of vomiting blood. School staff including the school nurse report observing clots in the blood, bright red blood, and brown coffee ground type blood in the vomit. The school staff called 911 and pt. was transported to Hospital. In the ambulance pt. vomited again and the paramedic reported observing blood in the vomit. Pt. was observed in the ER and given Zofran and liquids. Blood tests and a CT scan with and without contrast were performed. Neither tests explained the bloody vomiting. Pt has since stopped vomiting and is resting quietly at home and eating normally. The hospital referred Noah to a Gastroenterologist for follow up.

symptoms got worse and are just kind of staying the same now; throwing up; Vertigo; Dizziness; Nausea; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer. A 20-year-old male patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Formulation: Solution for injection, Lot Number: EW0175), via intramuscular, administered in arm left (shoulder) on 24May2021 at 16:00 (at the age of 20-years-old) as 2nd dose, single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included seasonal allergy. Family medical history included "his mom has Meniere's disease, it comes in rare spurts". Concomitant medication included fluticasone propionate (FLONASE [FLUTICASONE PROPIONATE]) 2 sprays per nostril daily in the morning and cetirizine hydrochloride (ZYRTEC [CETIRIZINE HYDROCHLORIDE]) 1 tablet by mouth every morning, both started on an unspecified date (been using them since he was like 12 years old), ongoing, taken for seasonal allergy. The patient previously received first dose of bnt162b2 (Lot Number: EW0176, Expiry date: unknown), administered in left shoulder on 03May2021 at about 16:00 for COVID-19 immunization and experienced soreness. The patient did not receive any additional vaccines on same date of the Pfizer suspect. The patient reported that he was having really bad side effects. He clarified that he had bad vertigo such that he could not do anything, but lay in the bed without getting dizzy. The dizziness was so bad that if he ate sitting up, he got nauseous and threw it all up. He reported that his symptoms all came on together. On 25May2021, after he ate, he felt like he could throw up but did not. On 26May2021, the patient ended up throwing up his dinner. He took Tylenol because it was recommended on 25May2021 and 26May2021. On 27May2021, his symptoms got worse and were just kind of staying the same. The nausea was if he moved his head around for a while like when walking, sitting up straight, or moving around for a while. Laying down was the only thing that did not make him feel sick. On the same day, he went to the emergency room and they diagnosed him with vertigo, but they did not know what was wrong. They prescribed him Meclizine for the dizziness. He was taking 1 tablet 3 times a day by mouth. The events dizziness and vertigo resulted in emergency room but not visited physician office. The patient did not undergo any relevant tests. The outcome of all the events was not recovered.

20 2021-06-07 indigestion pain; heart attack; couldn't talk, the pain was so hard; pain in his left arm; Indigestion; chest pa... Read more
Close
pain; heart attack; couldn't talk, the pain was so hard; pain in his left arm; Indigestion; chest pain; small temperature that was one degree higher than before; wiped out tired-extremely exhausted and tired; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient's mother). A 20-year-old male patient received the second dose of BNT162B2 (Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine, lot number and expiry date unknown), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in right arm on 13May2021 at 11:00 as a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. The patient's medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. The patient is very strict on his health. The patient is a vegetarian, he is very health conscious. The patient did not receive any other vaccinations within four weeks prior to the first administration of the COVID vaccine. The patient previously received the first dose of bnt162b2 on Apr2021 for COVID-19 immunization and experienced tenderness at the shot site and was very tired. On the morning of 14May2021, the patient had a small temperature that was one degree higher than before and the patient was wiped out tired-extremely exhausted and tired. Then the patient started experiencing chest pain within days of the second dose. The patient woke up on 15May2021 with chest pain that was persistent through 18May2021. On 19May2021, the chest pain got worse. The reporter thought the patient had indigestion so she gave the patient Tylenol, Pepcid, and clear soda and the patient felt a little better. On 20May2021, the patient was clutching his chest and had pain in his left arm. The patient couldn't talk, the pain was so hard. The patient went to the emergency room at 12:00 and the healthcare team said that the patient was experiencing a heart attack (reported time of heart attack was 10:00). The patient was not admitted to the hospital. They said the chemical that the large muscle in the heart makes, it was elevated which was how they determined it was a heart attack. These lab numbers were drawn every three hours and they came down but never went away. The patient had two Troponin draws and they were both elevated. They also did an EKG on the patient which showed a heart attack. The patient was told to see a cardiologist and was sent home. The reporter is watching the patient and the patient is still in a little bit of pain but not as much. The patient went to his primary care provider on the day of the report and the doctor doesn't see this as a displaced issue. The doctor does not know what would cause this in the heart. The patient is to see the cardiologist on Tuesday, 25May2021. The reporter is unsure if this is related to the vaccine but it was almost a week after the patient's second dose. The outcome of the event small temperature that was one degree higher than before was recovering and the outcome of the event wiped out tired-extremely exhausted and tired was not recovered. The outcome of the other events was unknown. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested

20 2021-06-10 vomiting, nausea Please see housestaff note for full details. In brief, 20-year-old neurologically normal man with hi... Read more
Close
Please see housestaff note for full details. In brief, 20-year-old neurologically normal man with history of asthma now presenting with new onset fever, headache and then status epilepticus. On 5/25 the patient received his second dose of COVID vaccine and then started to have intermittent fevers up to 102.5. This was associated with malaise, nausea, fever, headache, myalgias. He came to ED on 5/30 and had IVF, analgesics and a cardiac workup that was unremarkable and was discharged with diagnosis of possible pericarditis/myocarditis. He then had ongoing worsening headaches and increasing fevers and was unable to get out of his bed, and so his wife called 911 and he came to ED on 6/3. There he had vomiting and transaminitis and was diagnosed with gastroenteritis treated with flagyl. Headaches progressed and were associated with dizziness; he had HCT read as unremarkable but then while awaiting MRI had convulsion. He was returned to his room and had two more and thus was intubated, placed on propofol/versed, Keppra, dilantin, and broad-spectrum antibiotics and acyclovir before transfer to UCSF. on 6/5/2021 found to have reduced urine output, and serum creatinine found to be 1.72 and climbed >7 in days later normalized spontaneously with fluid support to 4.26 with continued improvement. LFTs were also found to be elevated. Was acutely encephalopathic. Seizures resolved on Keppra treatment though had acute agitation for several days. Slowly returning to neurologic baseline. with AKI and LFTs slowly normalizing.
20 2021-06-14 nausea NAUSEA, WOOZINESS TREATMENT- WATER, LAY ON THE COT
20 2021-06-16 diarrhea neurological symptoms such as anxiety and depression; neurological symptoms such as anxiety and depr... Read more
Close
neurological symptoms such as anxiety and depression; neurological symptoms such as anxiety and depression; flu like symptoms; fevers; chills; diarrhea; chest pain; shakiness; This is a spontaneous report received from a contactable The reporter. This The reporter reported for a 20-year-old male patient (Reporter's son) via medical information team. A 20-years-old male patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE, Formulation: Solution for injection, Lot Number: Unknown), via an unspecified route of administration on 14May2021 (20-year-old at the time of vaccination) as 1st dose, single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included illness from an unknown date and unknown if ongoing. He has been to the doctor for sick visits 20 times in 20 years. The reporter also stated that there are no mental health issues noted in their family history. The reporter also stated that the patient was overall healthy with no significant medical history in the past. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. The reporter reported that patient received the first dose of the Pfizer COVID 19 vaccine on Saturday and by Monday was having flu like symptoms, fevers, chills, diarrhoea, chest pain, shakiness, as well as other neurological symptoms such as anxiety and depression. He has been to the doctor for sick visits 20 times in 20 years. After receiving the COVID 19 vaccines, the patient has been seen by the doctor 3 times in one week. The patient's side effects have lasted 3-4 weeks. The reporter would like to know commonly reported side effects of the vaccine and their duration. The reporter would like to know the efficacy of only one dose of the Pfizer COVID 19 vaccine as the patient was hesitant to get the 2nd dose due to the side effects noted from the 1st vaccine. The reporter was advised per "attached" dose for efficacy after one dose. The reporter was not satisfied with this data and wanted to know more about what she had been read about online. The reporter was advised caller agent as could do some more research and contact her back with possible additional data which caller agreed to doing. Upon call back on 14Jun2021, advised caller per (website "PRIVACY") from 10Dec2020. The cumulative incidence of COVID-19 cases over time among placebo and vaccine recipients began to diverge by 12 days after the first dose, and 52.4% vaccine efficacy (95% confidence interval: 29.5, 68.4) was observed between dose 1 and dose 2, indicating the early onset of a partially protective effect of immunization. Two doses of vaccine provide the maximum protection observed. Ten cases of severe COVID-19 were observed with onset after the first dose. Nine cases occurred among placebo recipients and one among BNT162b2 recipients. The reporter would like to know dosing interval between shot one and two. Patient had their 1st dose on 14May2021 and has not received the 2nd dose yet due to side effects from what they felt was caused by the 1st dose of Pfizer COVID 19 vaccine. The reporter received response as "you should not get the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine if you had a severe allergic reaction after a previous dose of the vaccine or if you had a severe allergic reaction to any ingredient of the vaccine. The decision to receive the second dose for any other reason cannot be made by Pfizer. We refer you to speak to your healthcare provider about the risks of the vaccine compared to the risks of potentially not being fully protected against COVID-19 infection. Your healthcare provider knows your health situation and has access to information that can better help inform this decision". The reporter wanted to know should the patient get the 2nd dose of the Pfizer COVID 19 vaccine after the reported side effects of flu like symptoms, fevers, chills, diarrhoea, chest pain, shakiness, as well as other neurological symptoms such as anxiety and depression. The reporter received response as do not administer Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine to individuals with known history of a severe allergic reaction (e.g., anaphylaxis) to any component of the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine. The outcome of the events was resolved in 2021 Follow-up attempts are needed. Information about lot/batch number has been requested

Close
After 5 mins of receiving 1 st Pfizer covid vaccine at 10:55am, pt felt nauseous and dizzy. Pharmacist on duty instructed the patient to lay down facing up and started taking his blood pressure every 3 mins while giving the patient the electrolyte Vitamin drink( similar to Gatorade). His blood pressure and pulse readings were 100/60 (60), 93/51 (54), 104/62(68); 101/68(62), 108/79(67),109/79(67). So his blood pressure and pusle went down for 1 reading then it went back to his normal reading of 109/79 within 10 mins. After laying down for 15 mins and drinking vitamin drink, pt felt better as his nausea/dizziness went away. He felt okay and left the pharmacy at 11:30am. Pt reported no reactions to any vaccines before. His girlfriend called the dad to report the incident and the dad told her that his twin brother experienced the same reaction earlier today when receiving his covid vaccine at another site. His brother felt fine after 30 mins monitoring

Diarrhea; Fever of roughly 38.5C; Mild tiredness; Loss of appetite; Mild injections site tenderness; This is a spontaneous report received from a contactable consumer, the patient. A 20-year-old male patient received first dose of BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE, Lot number: ER8732) via an unspecified route of administrated on 26Mar2021 at 17:45 (at the age of 20-years-old) as a DOSE 1, SINGLE for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included COVID-19 from Dec2020 to unknown date. Concomitant medications were not reported. The patient had no known allergies to medications, food or other products. The patient did not received any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the vaccine. Prior to vaccination the patient was diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination the patient was not tested for COVID-19. On 27March2021 at 15:00 the patient experienced Fever of roughly 38.5C, mild tiredness, loss of appetite and mild injections site tenderness and at 15:45 after 22 hours of the first dose of vaccine, the patient experienced diarrhea. All foods consumed within the timeframe were unassociated with incidents of diarrhea in the past, though not frequently consumed. These included rye and mushroom soup, neither of which are associated with allergies or intolerances. The patient stated that this was not to say that there was a definitive connection with the first dose of the vaccine, but a correlation was present. The patient did not received any treatment for the reported events. The patient underwent lab tests or procedure, which include body temperature on 27Mar2021 and tested with a temperature of 38.5C. The clinical outcome of the events diarrhea, fever, mild tiredness, loss of appetite and mild injections site tenderness were recovering. No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information expected. Amendment: This follow-up report is being submitted to amend previously reported information: The date for Lab data captured as: 27Mar2021, Narrative 'The patient underwent lab tests or procedure, which include body temperature on an unknown date and tested with a temperature of 38.5C' update as 'The patient underwent lab tests or procedure, which include body temperature on 27Mar2021 and tested with a temperature of 38.5C' and Dose description was updated in narrative.

21 2021-04-06 vomiting First dose: Dec 16 Symptoms spanning 36 hours after injection as well as occasional joint pain in le... Read more
Close
First dose: Dec 16 Symptoms spanning 36 hours after injection as well as occasional joint pain in left elbow, wrist and knuckles. 36hr symptoms included: Fever, fatigue, muscle and joint pain in legs and arms, chills. 2nd dose, jan 6: Symptoms spanning ~60 hours (two days following vaccination + day of vaccination)Symptoms included: headache, low grade fever, muscle and joint pain in legs and both arms, chills. Symptoms almost completely resolved after that period, occasionally had some very mild joint pain still.*Note after both doses, pain in left arm was more severe than right arm* Starting the night of Jan 22 (fri) started having light leg pain, which carried into the 22nd. Dismissed it as too much walking the next day.Jan 24: leg pain a bit more severe, from a 1-2 to a 2-3. Included joint pain in left knee and ankle. Jan 25: pain in both legs at a 3-4, also mild pain in left arm (1-2) as well as joint pain. Jan 26: pain in left arm more severe, leg pain similar in severe. Very mild pain in right arm starting that evening, though only in upper arm. No joint pain in right arm Jan 27: pain in left arm similar in severity, slight increase in right arm pain, would rate 2-3 in right arm, 3-4 in left arm, 3-4 in legs. Muscle weakness in legs (legs shaking when walking down stairs for example) Jan 28 (Thurs):Symptoms started fading. Arm pain lowered in severity in both arms, as did leg pain. By Saturday all that remained was mild leg pain (1-2 in severity)Since then, leg pain has persisted. Week of Feb 14, leg pain increased in severity back to a 3-4. Visited the doctor on the 17th and had blood-work done on the 23rd after severity didn't decrease. Blood-work was normal other than slightly elevated lymphocyte % (50.8%)Visited a specialty medicine doctor on 2/25 and had x-rays done of legs. Results normal. Thought to have developed Achilles tendinitis. Possibly attributed to inflammation in legs, doctor wasn't sure. Rough quote "could it be from the vaccine, possibly, we just don't know." Have been doing stretches since which has helped the leg pain. Starting on March 12, I began to have pain in my left arm again, and ended up getting vertigo that evening. The arm pain persisted on and off from then on out, as well as occasional dizziness, which I treated with Dramamine. I did get an appointment scheduled with a neurologist in May that I still have. On March 25, I began to feel unwell, with a fever, dizziness, and a headache. That worsened into the evening, and I woke up at around 3 am with a high fever, that ended up going to about 103 F, and began vomiting around 4:30am on Friday, which persisted into the evening. On Saturday evening I began to feel better. With that recovery, the constant leg pain and frequent arm pain seemed to be gone, and has yet to return to the degree that it had been prior to that bout of sickness. I do still occasionally get arm or leg pain, but it's minor and only lasts about 20-30 minutes at a time.

Pharmacist took patient's blood pressure (148/62) and pulse (68) at 2:07pm. Patient reports to pharmacist that he had not eaten anything yet for the day and does have a fear of needles as well as history of passing out when getting blood drawn. Pharmacist provided a bottle of water and a plain chocolate bar for the patient to consume while waiting for EMS to arrive. EMS checked over patient since he complained of pain at the base of skull as a result from fall in the bathroom. EMS checked blood pressure (138/74) and blood sugar (78) at 2:18pm. EMS cleared the patient but did education the patient to report any signs or symptoms of concussion. Patient was then escorted home via his girl friend.

Patient received vaccine in left arm (deltoid). Was in post vaccination observation area. About 5 minutes after the injection, while sitting in the observation chairs, the patient fainted and hit his head on the floor. Pharmacist and patient's father got him back up into the chair. Patient quickly regained consciousness, but felt nauseous and warm. Patient was given a little water. But could carry-on a conversation. Patient vomited a little into a trash can. About 10 additional minutes went by. Patient was able to get up out of the chair and walk out of the facility with the help of his family. Patient had a little bit of bump on head where he had struck the floor, no bleeding occurred. No additional medical assistance was contacted at that time by the facility, family, or the pharmacist. Pharmacist called the patient several hours to after to see how he was doing, but did not get a response. The pharmacist left a voicemail. It is unknown to the pharmacist whether or not the family decided it was necessary to get medical follow-up or not after the incident.

Patient had nausea & vomiting x1, weak, felt nervous. Instructed to go to ED if feeling worse (N/V), fainting, shortness of breath/chest pain. Patient stable, released from vaccination site.

21 2021-05-03 nausea patient was nauseated 10 minutes after dose, proceeded to have tingling in feet first, then legs and... Read more
Close
patient was nauseated 10 minutes after dose, proceeded to have tingling in feet first, then legs and arms that moved into abdomen as well. Pain and extreme heaviness in arm shot was administered in. Ice packs were placed on arm and back of neck. Patient then stated after another 10-15 minutes that breathing was becoming labored and then both hands drew in and locked unable to move them. EMS was called at this time and EPIPEN was readied but not administered. Patient continued to communicate tingling was coming and going and after another 10 to 15 minutes breathing eased up and tingling in lip and body was fading along with able to move fingers but not thumbs. EMS arrived and took all vitals and cleared patient. About 15 minutes after patient was able to leave on own accord.

That resolved with a muscle relaxant and injection of toradol, but then on Mon May 3 begin experiencing massive new onset of anxiety and overwhelming depression (has never had this before). Unresolved as of today May 5 requiring patient to call off from work and be supervised 24/7 for safety. + loss of appetite. Currently in care of safe, healthcare trained family awaiting outpatient appointment and therapy.

Sunday 5/2/21 Experienced throbbing headaches, weakness, cold sweats, chills 102-103 fever, and red rash and dryness spreading to my chest. Monday 5/3/21 Experienced throbbing headaches, weakness, cold sweats, chills, 102-103 fever, and red rash and dryness on my face, chest, and neck. Tuesday 5/4/21 Experienced weakness, cold sweats, low grade fever, and red rash and dryness on my chest, neck, back, face, and groin. 21 2021-05-04 vomiting, nausea 21 year old previously healthy male had 2nd dose of COVID vaccine on 4/23. He had fever and chills o... Read more
Close
21 year old previously healthy male had 2nd dose of COVID vaccine on 4/23. He had fever and chills over the next two days that resolved spontaneously. On 4/26, he began having palpitations with onset of substernal chest pain described as a piece of metal on top of his chest. He also had nausea and vomiting. After 1 hour, he took one ibuprofen which resolved symptoms. On 4/27, he again had chest pain but immediately took ibuprofen which resolved symptoms. He saw his PCP on 4/28 and had abnormal EKG with ST and T wave abnormalities, elevated troponin of 10, and he was sent to the ED for further evaluation. He was given 324mg aspirin and admitted for observation. He did not have any additional symptoms, and echo was normal. Troponins down trended to 2 by 4/29, and he was discharged on a 5 day course of indomethacin with follow up with his PCP, no cardiology follow up required.

21 2021-05-18 nausea, vomiting Patient is a 21 y.o. male with no past medical history who got his second dose of COVID (Pfizer) vac... Read more
Close
Patient is a 21 y.o. male with no past medical history who got his second dose of COVID (Pfizer) vaccine on Saturday presented with chest pain since Sunday. Patient says that he was in his USOH until yesterday when he started having substernal chest pain which was getting worse with inspiration but also with specific movements. He does have pain even at rest sometimes but he thinks that it's exacerbating by breathing. Had some nausea/vomiting as well. Denies other symptoms. Not really sob or leg swelling. In the ER, his Trop I was 10.7 and his WBC was 12.2. His EKG was NSR with short PR and STE I, II, III, AVF, V4-V6 Patient is a 21 y.o. male with no past medical history who got his second dose of COVID (Pfizer) vaccine on Saturday presented with chest pain since Sunday with some pleuritic characteristics. He was found to have a very elevated trop I to 10.7, leukocytosis to 12.2 and STE in I, II, III, AVF, V4-V6. His POCUS in the ER was without significant pericardial effusion and probably normal EF. Differential at this point includes pericarditis vs myopericarditis (there are some myocarditis cases reported in Israel post Pfizer vaccination, predominantly in young male patients) vs less likely ACS. Will need admission and further work up and treatment -Admission to Cardiology -NPO in case team tomorrow decides to proceed to LHC -Full echo and cardiac MRI tomorrow -Telemetry monitoring -Repeat EKG q4h overnight -send CRP, ESR -trend Trop to peak -would not start heparin gtt at this point -Please start tonight ASA 650 TID + Colchicine 0.6 mg BID 21-year-old man admitted with signs and symptoms of acute myo-pericarditis or in the setting of recent COVID-19 vaccination. He apparently had the findings are vaccine 2 days ago and developed pleuritic chest pain. His ECG shows pathognomonic changes for pericarditis in the is a small troponin elevation. He has no past medical history or exertional symptoms to suggest CAD. Bedside echocardiogram showed preserved left ventricular systolic function. He was admitted and placed on aspirin and colchicine. A cardiac MRI today showed evidence of myopericarditis. He had 3 beats of nonsustained VT on tele.

21 2021-05-23 nausea my son was on a strenuous bicycle trip and reached his campground for the night. in the late evening... Read more
Close
my son was on a strenuous bicycle trip and reached his campground for the night. in the late evening he called me to report that he was suffering from nausea and rapid heartbeat (tachycardia). we assumed this was caused by heat exhaustion, but later I saw news reports about myocarditis being investigated as a possible side effect from the Covid-19 vaccine. my son fits the rough profile (young man) and experienced these symptoms three days after his second vaccination, so I thought this should be reported. He completed his bike trip (200 miles) and feels fine after taking one day to rest.

21 2021-05-28 nausea, vomiting, diarrhea Starting the day after the second dose of Pfizer mRNA, he developed prodrome with fever/chills, N/V/... Read more
Close
Starting the day after the second dose of Pfizer mRNA, he developed prodrome with fever/chills, N/V/D, systemic macular rash, and fatigue that persisted until presenting to the ED 9 days later. He was noted to be tachycardic and hypotensive with a severe leukocytosis, elevated inflammatory markers and + troponin, and an LVEF 35-40%. He was referred to tertiary care center, had a cardiac MRI that showed little inflammation but LVEF now 12%. On 5/21/21 he was started on high dose steroids and placed on mechanical circulatory support with VA ECMO. Cardiac function quickly improved and he is ready to come off VA ECMO 5/29 with an LVEF improved to > 40% during weaning trials.

2nd Dose: - Pain in the injection arm roughly ~9 hours after. - Pain escalated from a 1-2 to a 4-5 throughout the night. - Pain on left arm, near first injection site returned. Unsure if correlation or just early signs of body fatigue/soreness starting. - Minor swelling on right arm & was warm to touch. Applied ice pack and went to sleep. - Pain escalated to a 5-6 the following morning (6/16) at ~8-10am. - Full body fatigue started around 10-11am on 6/16. (No mental fog present, fatigue incl. soreness & general pain) - Throughout the day, chills are present intermittently. - Throughout the day, nausea is present intermittently. - At time of writing (9:05pm 6/16) pain is at a 3-4 on right arm, pain throughout body is a 2-3 depending on location. OTC pain medication such as Tylenol has limited effect. 1st Dose: (not sure if you want this but I will add it anyway) Received 5/13/2021 @ 1:40pm @ Clinic (same location as above; lot # above as well) - Pain in the injection arm roughly ~3-4 hours after. - Pain remained a low level 2-3 on a general pain index throughout the day. - Following morning, at ~8am (5/14) pain was a 3-4. Close
Nausea; body aches; headache; fatigue; This is a spontaneous report from a non-contactable other health care professional. A 21-year-old male patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Formulation: Solution for injection, Batch/Lot Number: EN5318), via intramuscular route of administration, administered in Left Arm on 02Feb2021 at 14:15 (at the age of 21-years-old) as First Dose, Single Dose for COVID-19 immunization. The patient's medical history included none. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. The patient did not get tested for COVID post vaccination. The patient did not suffer from COVID prior vaccination. 1hr after vaccination, on 02Feb2021 at 15:15 the patient experienced nausea, body ache, headache, fatigue. The patient did not receive any treatment for the AEs. The outcome for the events was recovering. No follow-up attempts are possible. No further information is expected.
21 2021-06-19 nausea Overnight after shot just typical symptoms, some slight chills and next day just a little tired Day ... Read more
Close
Overnight after shot just typical symptoms, some slight chills and next day just a little tired Day 2 after shot, April 11th. Chest pain, squeezing in chest. Unusual but manageable and didn?t feel terrible otherwise,maybe slightly tired. Tried leaning forward to make feel better. Day 3 and 4 chest pain/heart squeezing continued and was bothersome and, went to Urgent Care this day April 13th. EKG was a little abnormal and told to follow up with a cardiologist and take Advil. The heart squeezing feeling continued. Early morning hours April 14th very sick, excessive shaking (no fever), extreme nausea, faint feeling, dry cough (laying on bathroom floor). Not much, if any chest pain at the time. Went to ER. Not much chest pain during ER visit but nauseous and shaking etc. Test were run. Told that the symptoms were a delayed reaction to the vaccine and to follow up with a cardiologist because possible abnormal EKG and to take Advil as needed. Overnight at home, no chest pain but an hour of the shaking and nausea returned but not as bad as before. Over next couple days the chest pain/squeezing, slightly shakes and light headedness would come and go and by 4-16 feeling pretty great. The heart feeling mildly at most in the background but not debilitating. Starting week of April 20th maybe 4-5 flare ups with chest pain and no pattern but not debilitating. Could happen at rest. April 27th bigger flare up more debilitating, had to lie down, heart squeezing pain and maybe some wheezing when breathed in but not tightness in throat. Lasted about 30 minutes. Was just doing schoolwork with friends at the time so not under any physical or emotional stress at the time. After this from April 20 to May 3rd feeling heart symptom mildly but not debilitating and could resume normal active life. Had cardiology appt. May 3rd with nurse practitioner. According to NP the 12 Lead EKG run that day correlated with abnormal EKG from ER. Normal sinus rhythm with sinus arrhythmia Rightward axis Pulmonary disease pattern. Incomplete right bundle branch block Abnormal ECG. Given 4 lead heart monitor to wear for a week. Also ordered a CV CT angiogram coronaries with calcium scoring. The test could not be scheduled through them until July. Also told could go on hiking trip out west and to stop and rest if felt pain. For parents reassurance about hiking trip, had a second opinion over teleconference call with Dr., myocarditis specialist to confirm would be safe on hiking trip. Dr. said he should be good to go. He said these heart symptoms related to the second vaccine could fade over time. Hiking trip May 20th to May 30th. Did fine with exertion and just a few small episodes of the chest pain, light headedness and maybe a little shaking but these were at rest. Also, 4 lead heart monitor report was good. Returned from trip May 30th and no chest pain or symptoms for approximately 3 weeks through June 17th. June 18th went to urgent care for sore throat and ear. Prescribed amoxycillin. Took the amoxycillin and one Advil sinus, that evening had a heart squeezing episode return. This was the first time in almost 3 weeks. Did not take any more Advil sinus in case that caused the episode. Had another slight episode that evening. Hiked next day June 19th and fine. Then felt it slightly again after eating that afternoon of the 19th, also chest did feel a little tight all day. Then felt it again that evening. Still taking Amoxycillin as of today.

I have more tests this week to try and find out if I have endocarditis, so I am racking up all kinds of bills. So far no one believes me or will help me! ALL of this started within a few days of the second Pfizer dose of COVID vaccine. Biggest mistake of my life. I feel like I'm dying and no one will help. You are literally killing me.

Fast heartbeat; Anxiety; Nervousness; Stomach pain; Problems with his eyesight; Like stomach reactions like he is going to vomit but doesn't end up vomiting; Malaise; Headache; Fever; going to vomit but doesn't end up vomiting; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer or other non-healthcare professional (patient's father). A 21-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE solution for injection, Batch/Lot number was not reported), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in left arm on 07Jun2021 (21-year-old at the time of vaccination) as dose 2, single for covid-19 immunization. Medical history included not reported. The concomitant medications were none. The patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE solution for injection, Batch/Lot number was not reported), via an unspecified route of administration on an unspecified date on 2021 as dose 1, single for covid-19 immunization. On an unspecified date on 2021, the patient presented symptoms he had never had such as, fast heartbeat, malaise, anxiety, nervousness, headache, stomach pain, problems with his eyesight and fever. The patient had to be admitted into the emergency room, had several studies done and no abnormalities were diagnosed. The reporter stated that Pfizer covid vaccine on 07Jun2021. After the vaccine the patient had a fast heartbeat, general malaise, felt nervous, headache, a stomach-ache, and a fever. The patient had to go to the emergency room, and they performed tests and analysis on him and nothing came up. This event started about a week after the vaccine and his heart rate was speeding up. The heart rate and anxiety and headaches and like stomach reactions like he is going to vomit but doesn't end up vomiting. The symptoms are different on different days. The heart rate only happened once and everything has continued to happen. This happened after the second dose of the vaccine. They sent the patient from the emergency room to another place and admitted him for 2 days. The reporter is unsure of the dates of admission. They sent the patient to a hospital where there was a cardiologist and the patient stayed there for 2 days. As Per fact sheet, what are the risks of the Pfizer BioNTech covid-19 vaccine, revised: 25Jun2021, fast heartbeat is listed as one of the signs of a possible severe allergic reaction. Most of these side effects dont have a mean duration documented, some of the side effects have a range of appearance from 1-36 days. The reporter asked for treatment recommendations for patient. The events were serious - hospitalization. The outcome for the event's fast heartbeat, visual impairment, abdominal discomfort, pyrexia, going to vomit but doesn't end up vomiting were unknown and other events were not resolved. Information about batch/lot number has been requested.

Dizziness; vomitting; Headache; Chills; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer, the patient. A 21-year-old male patient received the second dose of BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Lot number: EN8734) via an unspecified route of administration in the left arm on 05Apr2021 at 13:45 (at the age of 21-years-old) as a single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient did not receive any other medications within two weeks of vaccination. The patient had no known allergies to medications, food or other products. The patient previously received first dose of BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Lot number: EN6208) via an unspecified route of administration in the left arm on 14Mar2021 at 16:00 (at the age of 21-years-old) as a single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Prior to the vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within four weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. On 05Apr2021, the patient experienced dizziness, vomiting, headache and chills. The events did not result in doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit, and emergency room/department or urgent care visit. The patient did not receive any treatment for the events. The clinical outcome of the events dizziness, vomiting, headache and chills was resolving at the time of this report. No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information is expected.

Red rash on face, neck, chest and arm; difficulty swallowing; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable nurse (patient). A 22-year-old male patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot ELO140) intramuscular on 26Dec2020 18:30 (06:30 PM) at a single dose on the right arm as COVID-19 vaccine. Medical history included previously diagnosed with COVID-19 prior to vaccination. The patient had no known allergies to medications, food, or other products. There were no concomitant medications. The patient had adverse events of red rash on face, neck, chest and arm; and difficulty swallowing, both on 26Dec2020 19:00 (07:00 PM) assessed as non-serious. It did not result in death, not life threatening, did not caused/prolonged hospitalization, not disabling/incapacitating, did not cause congenital anomaly/birth defect. There was no treatment for the events. The patient was vaccinated in a hospital (facility where the most recent COVID-19 vaccine was administered). He had no other vaccine within four weeks prior to the COVID vaccine, no other medications within two weeks of vaccination. He did not have Covid tested post vaccination. The outcome of the events was recovered on Dec2020.

Close
Four minutes after receiving Pfizer Covid 19 Vaccination (#1 of series), client lost consciousness. Client was diaphoretic, pale. Consciousness returned almost immediately. BP 100/70, Pulse 62, Oxygen Saturation 96%. Client reported feeling nausea as well. Client instructed to place head between legs and take deep breaths. No medication was provided. Ice applied to neck. 5-8 minutes later client was escorted to clinic exam room via wheelchair and placed in supine position. Client observed an additional 30 minutes while symptoms gradually improved. Client ambulated on own to his vehicle after observation period.

Close
Around 10pm, I was suddenly very tired and could not stop yawning. I typically am up until 12-1 most nights so this was out of the ordinary. While getting ready for bed I became very nauseous and almost threw up. I had waves of nausea for around 20 minutes. When I stood up I had chills throughout my body and my skin was covered in goosebumps. A little later, my vision started to go black and I felt dizzy and light-headed. I went to bed shortly after in hopes of sleeping it off (probably 10:45-11). Around 2 am the following morning, I woke up and had a hot flash (could have been a fever but I did not check my temperature). I was able to fall back asleep and felt normal when I woke up at 7:30 am.

Close
Patient received dose 1 of the COVID vaccine (lot EW0150, exp 7/2021) at 1420. At 1425, patient approached EMT reporting he felt dizzy, nauseous, sweaty, and anxious. The patient reported having a similar reaction when getting previous injections due to a fear of needles and blood. PHN approached to assist. Vital signs: blood pressure 90/48, O2 97%, pulse 56, respirations 18. Patient denied allergies, medical conditions, or current medications. Patient reported not eating breakfast. At 1427, EMT offered patient water. PHN offered patient Benadryl but patient declined, also advised to contact provider and when to call 911. Patient reported he did not have a medical provider, PHN advised patient to contact 211 for assistance. At 1430, vital signs: blood pressure 102/58, pulse 74, O2 94%, respirations 18. Patient reported symptoms had resolved and he felt back to baseline. At 1445, vital signs: blood pressure 104/52, O2 94%, pulse 71, respirations 18. Patient denied anxiety at this point. At 1455, vital signs: blood pressure 98/58, pulse 74, O2 94%, respirations 16. Patient left walking with steady gait.

22 2021-05-02 difficulty swallowing Pt reported reaction with #1 dose of mild SOB and itchy throat. Given PO Benadryl and brought to ED ... Read more
Close
Pt reported reaction with #1 dose of mild SOB and itchy throat. Given PO Benadryl and brought to ED for his SOB, though no additional treatments administered. Both ED Physician and PCP advised pt should still receive #2 dose. Pt presented prior to dose with normal mentation, and no difficulty ambulating or verbalizing beyond baseline. Pt had no issues when receiving vaccine then called over staff 2-3 minutes after vaccination to report SOB. EMS notified and staff. EMT and staff. EMR came to assist patient. Clinical Lead notified of 1st dose reaction and current reaction after SOB onset began and EMS brought over. Pt provided PO Benadryl 5 minutes after vaccine administered and able to swallow with no issue. I, Clinical Lead, remained at patient side where patient was able to describe his pain but had dyspnea and only able to get out 2-3 words at a time. After a few minutes, pt SOB worsened to the point he was unable to speak but no color changes noted. Mentation declined with pt somnolence present. At this point, Clinical Lead called 911 for backup as Benadryl had no relief of symptoms and SOB worsened along with mentation. Also noted that EMS pulse ox was not working so unable to provide accurate O2 saturation to delineate whether reaction was anxiety or allergic. Pt also noted history of seizure disorder though declined feeling was a current seizure and denied history of respiratory or cardiac conditions. Paramedics felt pt needed transport to the hospital and report provided by Clinical lead.

Nausea has resolved but patient continues to have per-umbilical abdominal cramping with decreased appetite. Patient doesn't think he's lost any weight. No body aches, no fever.

Close
Client received his vaccination successfully without incident. However, as he stood by to observe his friend receive his injection, client became dizzy and nauseous. Client walked over to trash can and threw up. Dr. present for assessment client. Client appeared pale and confirmed SOB, denied dizziness and nausea. VS: #1 BP: 83/45, P: 58, O2: 98%; #2 BP: 103/59; #3 BP: 122/86, P: 96. Dr. encouraged client to drink a bottle of water and a bottle of Gatorade. Client was compliant. After-which, client denied SOB, dizziness and nausea. Color returned to his face. Dr. released client to be observed for 15 more minutes under the observation tent. Client denied discomfort, dizziness and nausea at time of departure. Client was stable when he exited the premises.

22 2021-05-18 nausea Approximately 2 minutes after receiving the vaccine, patient stated that he felt nauseous. Patient w... Read more
Close
Approximately 2 minutes after receiving the vaccine, patient stated that he felt nauseous. Patient was seated in observation area. Patient stated that he had no other pain or complaints. Pt appeared diaphoretic. Vital signs taken at 2:23pm were as follows. Pulse 44 regular and strong, BP 82/41, respiratory rate 14 and unlabored, oxygen saturation 95%. EMS was called. Patient was asked to lie down and his legs were elevated. Patient stated that he felt better and no longer felt nauseous. Vital signs at 2:28pm in Trendelenburg position were pulse 50, BP 109/56, O2 sat 98%, RR 14. Lung sounds were clear and equal bilaterally. Pt reported no difficulty breathing, no tightness or pain in chest, and no swelling in face. Vital signs at 2:30pm in trendelenberg position were pulse 56, BP 115/70, RR 14, O2 sat 99%. Patient was asked to sit up. He stated that he felt fine and returned to chair. Vital signs at 2:33 in chair were pulse 58, BP 109/66, O2 Sat 98%. EMS arrived and assessed the patient. Patient stated that he did not want to go to hospital. EMS released patient.

appendicitis/diagnosis was acute appendicitis with prerenal azotemia; appendicitis/diagnosis was acute appendicitis with prerenal azotemia; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer. A 22-years-old male patient received bnt162b2 (BNT162B2), dose 2 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Left on 11May2021 12:45 (Batch/Lot Number: EW0176) as SINGLE DOSE for covid-19 immunisation. The patient medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. Patient previously received the first dose of BNT162B2 on 20Apr2021 for covid-19 immunization (lot_number=ER8735,lot_unknown=False, administration_date=20Apr2021,administration_time=12:30 PM, dose_number=1,vaccine_location=Left arm]. He did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. The patient experienced appendicitis/diagnosis was acute appendicitis with prerenal azotemia on 14May2021 10:00 with outcome of recovering, lower abdominal pain on 14May2021 10:00 with outcome of recovering. The patient was hospitalized for appendicitis/diagnosis was acute appendicitis with prerenal azotemia for 2 days.The patient was hospitalized for lower abdominal pain for 2 days. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included computerised tomogram: acute appendicitis on 14May2021, sars-cov-1 test negative: negative on 14May2021 Nasal Swab. Three days after receiving his second dose, he noticed lower abdominal pain, which resulted in visit to his primary care physician, who suspected appendicitis. He was immediately sent to the hospital for a CT scan that Friday night, and had surgery to remove my appendix Saturday morning. Official diagnosis was acute appendicitis with prerenal azotemia. He was discharged Sunday afternoon. Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of all events. The all events were reported as seriousness criteria of life-threatening. Information on lot/batch number was available. Additional information has been requested.

22 2021-05-27 nausea, vomiting Chest Pain, Myopericarditis; From EPIC: From cardiologist healthy man who comes to the ER with left ... Read more
Close
Chest Pain, Myopericarditis; From EPIC: From cardiologist healthy man who comes to the ER with left anterior chest discomfort for the last 36 hours or so. Symptoms are made worse by deep inspiration. Were improved following self administration of 600 mg of ibuprofen earlier today. 2 days ago he received his second COVID-19 vaccine (Pfizer). Following day he experienced arm pain muscular aches and pains severe discomfort of the right arm (injection site) later in the day there was nausea and vomiting on one occasion (nonheme). By last night he was able to eat dinner but subsequently felt short of breath with worsening chest discomfort morning the left arm continued to ache with musculoskeletal pains. Developed more discomfort in the left anterior chest radiating to the throat made worse by deep inspiration. Does not describe typical sharp catching pain of pericarditis. No cough sputum bruising bleeding abdominal pain change in color or character of bowels. Sign in the emergency room he was hemodynamically stable, in sinus rhythm with a normal EKG.Torrey work-up notable for an initial troponin of 1.28 and a follow-up troponin of 2.14. Chest x-ray perfectly normal. Elevated d-dimer. CT angiography negative for pulmonary embolism vascular injury, cardiomegaly, pericardial effusion but the radiologist did note thickening of several right posterior and lateral axillary lymph nodes raising a question of recent right-sided vaccination or injury/infection to the right arm. Presently he is perfectly comfortable able to take a deep inspiration with mild chest discomfort, breathing easily. I met him in July 2018He came to the emergency room with a 3-day viral syndrome manifested as headache nausea vomiting diarrhea and abdominal discomfort and then developed chest discomfort. He was found with diffuse mild J-point elevation on EKG consistent with a viral type pericarditis with troponins which rose to a maximum of 10.4. Work-up for myocarditis was negative. Echocardiogram perfectly normal. Symptoms responded to a course of nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory agents and colchicine. Seen in follow-up of repeat echocardiogram was perfectly healthy. Our diagnosis was myopericarditis. There is no history of shortness of breath dyspnea on exertion decrement of exercise capacity peripheral edema orthopnea PND palpitations lightheadedness syncope or collapse. No ill contacts. He works in a high security position and therefore qualified for early administration of the Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine. Graph past medical history notable only for the episode of myopericarditis and a remote tonsillectomy. There is no significant family history of sudden cardiac death or unusual heart disease. He takes no medications. Patient was recommended to take 4 weeks of ibuprofen and colchicine if needed for worsening chest pain. Patient was recommended to follow-up closely with his primary care doctor and check ESR, C-reactive protein as well as renal function. Needs close follow-up with cardiology as an outpatient.

The patient experienced vomiting , fever and dizziness all on 26Feb2021 21:00 with outcome of recovering. No follow-up attempts are possible; information about lot/batch number cannot be obtained.
22 2021-06-01 diarrhea, vomiting, nausea Reason for Admission Patient 22-year-old male with a history of seasonal allergic asthma who presen... Read more
Close
Reason for Admission Patient 22-year-old male with a history of seasonal allergic asthma who presented to ER with a chief complaint of chest pain. He said he started having multiple episodes of vomiting/fever on Saturday morning, went to urgent care and diagnosed with sinus infection, prescribed amoxicillin, then he started having chest pain on Sunday at 4 PM, mid sternum, constant, pressure type of pain, 5 out of 10 in severity, worse with cough and deep breathing/lying down flat a lateral position, better with sitting up/ leaning forward. No radiation. Denies lifting any heavy weight or any heavy exercise. Never had similar symptoms in the past. He had his second dose Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine on May 12. He denies leg pain or swelling. His vomiting and fever resolved. ED: He was found to have troponin of more than 12,000, EKG showed diffuse ST segment elevation with possible repolarization. Transferred for possible cardiac cath/cardiac MRI. CT angio chest no PE, normal aorta, no infiltration. Pending second set of troponin, stat echo, aspirin po given in the ER. In addition to the above HPI, he reports having 2 days of fevers, chills, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea. T-max 103F. His chest pain began around 4 PM yesterday and he felt like it was initially consistent with his asthma, however it did not improve so around 1:30 AM he states they went to the ER. He states that the chest pain gets better with exertion, and is worse with deep breaths and lying on his side, or leaning forward. He did take Nyquil decongestant which contains phenylephrine. Hospital Course 22 yo M w/PMH exercise induced asthma admitted for evaluation of CP, elevated troponin to 21,292 with negative LHC. UDS Negative. EKG w/diffuse ST changes so consistent with Myopericarditis I31.9 given Recent Viral Illness resulting in first time myopericarditis, will treat per pericarditis algorithm, ASA+Colchicine w/90% response rate by 1 week. -ASA 650 to 1000 mg TID, weekly tapers if CRP normalized and sx free; will start at 650 mg dose -Colchicine 0.6 mg BID for 3 months, no taper (lowers recurrence rate, NNT = 5) -Glucocorticoid generally not indicated in first-time acute myopericarditis as observational studies suggest increased recurrence rate, but can consider if he does not adequately respond to aspirin and colchicine -Trend troponin to ensure downtrend continues -No strenuous exercise during recovery period

Patient did not seek medical attention that evening, called his PCP next day and was advised to follow up. Two days later patient still experiencing some headaches and nausea, advised to go to local ED (hospital) patient had labs drawn and received a CT scan, reported all were unremarkable. Patient is in the process of following up with Neurology and undergoing and EEG for suspected seizure.

Close
On Friday, May 14, 2021 started to have aches and flu-like symptoms. Then on Saturday, May 15, 2021. developed a migraine-like headache and chest pain along with worsening flu-like symptoms. By midnight Sunday, May 16, 2021 awoke with 8-9 out of 10 chest pain, with copious amounts of vomiting, a 9 out of 10 headache, abdominal pain with a feeling of hot than freezing, shivering, unable to keep clear liquids down. No loose stools, reported having a normal bowel movement. reported that since the vomiting started overnight the chest pain got no better but felt worse like an elephant was sitting on his chest. was taken to Hospital emergency department where he was originally treated, Tests performed were bloodwork including Troponin levels, EKG, Chest X-Rays, and CT scan. Per the Physician Assistant who initially saw stated that his EKG was abnormal than his Troponin level was elevated. Due to concerns withs history of Marfan Syndrome and the possibility of a torn aorta, increased Troponin, abnormal EKG the ED doctor wanted him helicoptered to Hospital's Cardiac Cath Lab to rule out a torn aorta. was helicoptered to Hospital taken to the Cardiac Cath Lab ruling out a torn aorta. After IV fluid hydration and other treatment, was diagnosed with myocarditis. Upon discharge, was placed on medication and to follow up with his PCP and cardiologist on 6/25/21.

On Friday night, April 16,2021, after working all day for his job, Pt told his roomates that he wasn't feeling well, was throwing up, had the chills and was going to lay down. When the roomates didn't see him Monday morning, April 19, 2021, they went into his room and found him unresponsive. The medical examiner ruled death due to cancer which appears incorrect considering the evidence.
22 2021-06-19 nausea The side effects didn't all occur simultaneously. Friday evening I noticed severe arm soreness. Late... Read more
Close
The side effects didn't all occur simultaneously. Friday evening I noticed severe arm soreness. Later Friday night (about 10 hours after getting the vaccine) I developed gradual onset chills, body aches, and fatigue. Saturday I woke up with a severe headache, body aches, fatigue, and fever. The headache became severe by mid-day, with fatigue also worsening throughout the day. Sunday was more of the same, though I believe the fever started inching down and the headache lessened. What developed Sunday afternoon/evening took me off guard though. I noticed a sudden drop in heart rate, a feeling of pressure and discomfort in the chest, nausea, and shortness of breath with exertion (consistently - not just once). (I'm a long-distance runner, so this is unusual for me.) At first I debated going to the emergency room, but since I'm so young and in otherwise good condition I thought nothing of it. I had similar symptoms the following day, but I avoided exerting myself until all of my symptoms from the vaccine had ended. I felt groggy and fatigued for several additional days, but by Saturday (8 days after getting the first dose of Pfizer) everything had resolved. I also developed swollen lymph nodes, which returned to normal size within about 3 weeks (before swelling again after the second vaccine). The second dose of the vaccine caused a more sudden and intense reaction, though I never developed chest pain/slow heart rate with it. Instead I developed sudden onset severe chills, fatigue, and body aches about 9 hours after getting the shot. A fast heart rate, shortness of breath, and sudden onset fever (temperature jumped nearly five degrees in about 90 minutes) quickly followed. My fever stabilized around 102.2 around 3 a.m. that morning, and slowly crept down throughout the afternoon/evening. Overall, with dizziness, body aches, extreme fatigue, etc., this was the sickest I've been since I had a severe case of the Flu in high school. The fatigue, shortness of breath, and fast heart rate continued for about a week - getting slightly better each day.
22 2021-06-24 nausea, decreased appetite body aches; Dizziness; Nausea; loss of appetite; chills; fatigue; itching; This is a spontaneous rep... Read more
Close
body aches; Dizziness; Nausea; loss of appetite; chills; fatigue; itching; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer or other non hcp. A 22-year-old male patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Batch/Lot Number: unknown; Expiration Date: unknown), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Right on 28Jan2021 (22-year-old at the time of vaccination), as a single dose for covid-19 immunization. The patient's medical history included non-sustained ventricular tachycardia diagnosed at birth, pacemaker and defibrillator. The reporter stated that her son has a serious heart condition, pacemaker/defibrillator- first was in 6th grade, currently on his fourth and drug hypersensitivity states they monitored them both longer than the 15 minutes because they have a history of serious allergic reactions to ACE inhibitors. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. The patient continues taking his low dose aspirin prior to the vaccine but did not take any Tylenol. On 28Jan2021, the patient experienced dizziness, nausea, loss of appetite, chills, body aches, fatigue, and itching. The outcome of all the events was recovered on 29Jan2021. Information about lot/batch number has been requested. Follow-up attempts are completed. No further information is expected.

Close
On the morning of 04-16-2021 I had a syncope in my restroom at my home. When I awoke I had convulsions. On Friday night, I developed fever, shakiness of my legs. On Sunday I had blurred vision, had nausea and had trouble breathing. These symptoms lasted one month. I had vertigo, nausea and had trouble breathing. As of today, I still have difficulty breathing, the nausea and dizziness are not present today. I will not get my second vaccine due to my symptoms to my first vaccine.
22 2021-06-26 nausea Client received COVID vaccine Pfizer (Lot# EW0187 expiration 07/15/21) at 1316. Client was sitting i... Read more
Close
Client received COVID vaccine Pfizer (Lot# EW0187 expiration 07/15/21) at 1316. Client was sitting in the vaccination chair at 1320 when RN noticed Client was pale and fatigued. RN asked for help by a neighboring Ancillary, but RN and Ancillary responded at 1322. RN, RN, and Ancillary aided Client to zero-gravity chair. Student Nurse notified PHN, PHN, and PHN at 1326. At 1327, vital signs are blood pressure 116/60, heart rate 60, oxygen saturation 96%. Client reports being nausea at the start of intervention, but reports nausea been resolved, vision is non-blurry, slight headache, and feels dizzy. Client was offered water and accepted. Client reports a history of fainting, deaf in the left ear, and allergies to sulfa. Client's mother is present at the time of adverse effect. At 1331, vital signs are blood pressure 122/62, heart rate 63, oxygen saturation 98%. Client reports headache has improved, no nausea, no blurred vision, and dizziness has improved. PHN gave Client and the client's mother education on common adverse effects of COVID vaccine and ED precautions. At 1336, vital signs are blood pressure 118/62, heart rate 73, oxygen saturation 96%. Client reports no new symptoms, skin tone has returned to appropriate coloration related to ethnicity. Client remains in the zero-gravity chair drinking water. At 1341, vital signs are blood pressure 112/64, heart rate 66, oxygen saturation 99%. Client reports all symptoms had resolved. At 1346, vital signs are blood pressure 110/60, heart rate 68, oxygen saturation 97%. Client reports no complaints. At 1356, vital signs are blood pressure 112/62, heart rate 65, oxygen saturation 96%. Client reports no complaints. Client stood up with no complaints and left facility at 1357 and was accompanied by his family.

Upon regaining consciousness, the patient was able to recall what had occurred before the seizure, but said he did not remember what happened after the vaccine, and that he felt that he had defecated in his pants.

At approximately 1605, patient reported feeling nauseous in vaccination chair. Patient vomited in emesis bag. Patient reported feeling anxious before vaccination and a history of anxiety and panic attacks. Patient reported vomiting after receiving an unspecified vaccine in 2019. Patient offered anti-gravity chair. Patient refused anti-gravity chair. Patient denied difficulty breathing, difficulty swallowing, itchiness, rashes and hives. Patient advised to wait for further observation. Patient given water. At 1615, EMT assessed patient vital signs: blood pressure 136/88 mmHg and pulse 115 beats/minute. At 1621, EMT reassessed patient vital signs: blood pressure 130/80 mm Hg and pulse 78 beats/minute. At 1633, EMT reassessed patient vitals: blood pressure 112/76 mmHg and pulse 74 beats/minute. At 1635, lead nurse assessed patient. Patient denied feeling nauseous. Patient stated "I feel okay". Lead nurse educated patient on signs/symptom of when to seek emergency care, to sign up on v-safe, and to follow up with primary care provider. At approximately 1640, patient left facility with unlabored respirations and steady gait.

Patient received the Pfizer COVID vaccine (lot EW0191) at approximately 1625 in the Collaboration Room, to provide more privacy at patient's request. Pharmacist vaccinated patient and remained with the patient for observation period. At 1630, the patient vomited and PHN approached to assess. Patient reported feeling hot and sweaty before vomiting, and relief after emesis. At 1632, vital signs: blood pressure 134/88, pulse 70, O2 97%, respirations 18. Patient reported having a similar reaction after receiving the 1st Pfizer dose and after the meningococcal vaccine. PHN noted no swelling or work of breathing. Patient reported a fear of needles. Patient did not follow up with his provider after the 1st dose of Pfizer COVID vaccine. Patient reported eating a full meal and drinking water throughout the day. PHN encouraged patient to follow up with provider and symptoms in which to call 911. Patient reported no allergies, medical conditions, nor medications. PHN offered patient Benadryl but patient declined. AT 1650, vital signs: blood pressure 122/80, O2 98%, pulse 80, respirations 16. Patient reported symptoms had resolved. Patient drank water offered by Pharmacist. Patient left walking with steady gait at 1703.

Patient reported having dizziness after the vaccination, he also mentioned he had a little feeling of nausea. He reported that this happened to him before after he getting any kind of injections. We called 911, the ambulance came, monitored and checked his vital signs. Patient refused to go to the hospital. He was feeling much better after sitting and drank some water. Patient accompanied by a friend who drive him home. Our corporate reporting line was contacted and reported the incident as well.
22 2021-07-26 nausea, vomiting Received Pfizer vaccines on 5/18/21, 6/8/21. Began feeling ill on 7/21/21 w/ cough, sore throat, vom... Read more
Close
Received Pfizer vaccines on 5/18/21, 6/8/21. Began feeling ill on 7/21/21 w/ cough, sore throat, vomiting, nausea, myalgias, chills, H/A. Tested positive for COVID-19 by PCR on 7/23/21.
22 2021-07-27 abdominal pain Approximately two weeks after receiving the second dose I began to notice abdominal pain that worsen... Read more
Close
Approximately two weeks after receiving the second dose I began to notice abdominal pain that worsened when breathing or laying down. The pain became more severe over the course of the next few days that I admitted myself to the emergency room of the Hospital. A CT scan showed a pulmonary embolism located in my lower right-hand lung, which would have killed me if left untreated. I was admitted to the hospital and treated for pain and given intravenous blood thinners for 3-4 days. I was discharged with orders to follow up with a pulmonologist, cardiologist, and PCP. I was unable to schedule visits with the specialists due to financial constraints. After leaving the hospital my condition began to improve and has continued to improve since. As I understand it, the tissue in my lung may never heal and as a result i suffer diminished lung capacity.
23 2021-01-07 nausea, diarrhea, vomiting At 2:00am 12/19/20 I woke up to an episode of diarrhea and was left feeling nauseous. I woke up agai... Read more
Close
At 2:00am 12/19/20 I woke up to an episode of diarrhea and was left feeling nauseous. I woke up again at 4:30am with another episode of diarrhea and severe nausea which led me to throw up. I feel better after throwing up and proceeded to get rest before going to work at 6:00am. By 8:00am I had developed a severe headache, severe nausea, muscle fatigue and overall felt bad. When I got home I had become extremely nauseous and developed severe muscle fatigue and severe arthralgia and my headache had increased and became sweaty and dizzy. I slept from 9:00am to 2:00pm where the symptoms had gotten no better and the headache had gotten worse. I slept from 3:00pm to around 6:00pm with the same symptoms but managed to eat some soup and kept it down. I slept from 10pm to 12pm the next day 12/10/20. My fatigue and joint pain had somewhat dissipated but I was still experiencing severe nausea and a severe headache. By the end of 12/10/20 around 8pm my joint pain and muscle fatigue had gotten better but the nausea and headache were still there. 12/11/20 I was well enough to drive and receive a covid test. My nausea and headache did not go away until the end of day 12/11/20

Nausea; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable other hcp, the patient. This 23-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 mRNA vaccine) (Lot number: EK9231), intramuscularly in the left arm on 07Jan2021 at 10:00 (at the age of 23-years-old) as a single dose for COVID-19 vaccination. The patient's medical history was not reported. The patient did not have any allergies to medications, food, or other products. Prior to the vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within four weeks prior to the vaccination. Concomitant medication included acetylsalicylic acid (BABY ASPIRIN) and cetirizine hydrochloride (ZYRTEC [CETIRIZINE HYDROCHLORIDE]). On 07Jan2021 at 10:15, the patient experienced nausea. No therapeutic measures were taken as a result of the events. The clinical outcome of the nausea was resolving. It was also reported that since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19.

Close
No adverse affect after 1st dose. After second dose, no arm pain was felt, but joint aches and a fevers were prevalent around hour 8 after injection. Around hour 10, a fever of 100 F set in and quickly rose to 102 before hour 12. Fever reached 103 by hour 12.5 and broke by hour 13. After fever broke, vomiting/dry heaving occurred for roughly 2 hours. Lethargy/ LOC set in around hour 16 and the former remained until around hour 48. After the course, I began to feel fine, I just wanted to report how adverse my side effects were compared to those of my coworkers.

Called to doctor and patient lowered to floor and placed in recovery position, MSE lasted approximately 30 seconds, EMS called. Post seizure: Patient very pale and diaphoretic, oriented to person quickly, no signs of facial swelling, resp distress or symptoms of a severe allergic reaction. A 23-year-old male patient received second dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE, Formulation: solution for injection, Lot number: EL3248) via an unspecified route of administration in the left arm on 09Feb2021 at 07:00 (at the age of 23-year-old) as a single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient relevant medical history and concomitant medication were not reported. The patient previously took historical vaccine, first dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE, Lot number: EL3248) in the left arm on 19Jan2021 at 07:00 for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient did not have any allergies to medications, food, or other products. Prior to the vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within four weeks prior to the vaccination. The patient experienced headaches, nausea, soreness at injection site on 09Feb2021 at 20:00. The patient did not receive any treatment for the events. The events were reported as non-serious by the reporter. The outcome of the events headaches, nausea, soreness at injection site was recovered on an unknown date in Feb2021.

Close
At approximately 3:28 pm, Patient reported feelings of nausea, skin color was grey and clammy to touch within minutes of receiving dose 1 Pfizer. Initially vitals were taken, O2 sat was 90 and his heart was in the 40's. PA was present and felt patient needed to be sent to the ED for further evaluation. Within minutes the vitals stabilized and patients color returned to normal but continued to report mild nausea and dizziness, consulted Dr who suggested if symptoms persisted to send him to the ED. EMS called for transport at 3:45. Pt was transported to the ED at 4pm.
