23 year old male with a history of 31 allergic reactions, Mast cell activation syndrome, Addisons disease, and POTS, developed anaphylactic reaction after receiving first Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine. Patient took 50 mg benadryl 30 minutes before arriving at vaccine clinic in anticipation of possible reaction per physician's recommendation. Per pt he asked multiple physicians regarding receiving the covid vaccine and was given the permission to proceed. Also took 20mg hydrocortisone in the morning, then 10mg this afternoon for Addison's disease. 1603 - Pt received 1st dose of Pzifer covid-19 vaccine and during the first 5 minutes of observation complained of feeling itchy and wheezing, light headed, nauseous. 1608 - 0.3mg epi given at - self administered right thigh. 1613 - 90 mg of hydrocortisone (solu-cortef), patient's own medication, given by RN through pt's PICC line RUE; line was flushed with NS before and after and cleaned with alcohol swab. 1615 - Self-administered 4 mg Zofran (patient's own medication) at 1615 into the RUE PICC; cleaned with alcohol swab. 1615- Second 0.3mg of epi given- self administered left thigh. 1617 - Fire department arrived. 1621- pt complains of itchiness still but wheezing is reduced. BP 118/83 at 4:25 PM, normal O2 sat and pulse, normal respiratory rate. 1626 - patient placed in gurney, escorted out by Fire Dept en route to Hospital Physician assistant and five other RN were with the patient and his mother.

Close
After giving the patient his Covid Vaccine, he tensed up and said he was feeling like he may vomit. He then became very pale and fainted while in the vaccination chair. After a few seconds he regained consciousness. We then helped him to the floor and elevated his legs and placed a cold pack on his neck. He started feeling better instantly but we kept him there for about 5 minutes. We then had him move to a chair and the technician sat with him for an additional 40 minutes. He then said he was fine and that he has fainted before (which was not disclosed) and left.

Close
Roughly 12 hours after dose, began feeling chills. (roughly 11 pm on day of second dose). By 2 am, Saturday, symptoms had reached their worse. For the next 12 hours, had hot and cold flashes, along with strong headaches. Nausea when standing or moving quickly. Likely fever. Nighttime acetaminophen taken at about 6 am. By 2 pm the next day, able to stand. Nausea gone, and hot and cold flashes not as bad (but still present). Appetite was poor. Regular acetaminophen taken at around 2 pm. By end of Saturday (10 pm), headache and chill/heat, but to a lesser degree. Nighttime acetaminophen taken at 10pm or so. Next day, Sunday, most symptoms were gone, except for join pains. Neck in particular was sore when head was tilted at all. Monday, all symptoms gone. Maybe some minor soreness.

Close
Vasovagal syncope in the 15 minute waiting period. Response by staff was great: laid me down, brought a cot, regularly checked my heart rate, blood oxygen, and blood pressure until it returned to normal and waited to make sure the symptoms did not return. Later that night, I started experiencing some of the typical COVID vaccine side effects: sore arm, chills, nausea, and fever-like symptoms; in addition to the symptoms I was warned was possible, I also experienced periods of dizziness and an uncomfortable sense of balance. Three days later, the dizziness and other common symptoms have gone away, but my sense of balance still feels off, although I do not know if related to the vaccine. It?s not so bad that I?m at risk of falling over, but I have a semi-regular feeling of unsteadiness which I cannot explain.

Close
not feeling well; he felt really terrible yesterday; Fatigue; on the left side of his throat, it hurt to swallow/throat pain; on the left side of his throat, it hurt to swallow/throat pain; last night (07Apr2021), he had a really bad headache; Sensation of pressure in ear; Sensation of pressure in eye; Dizzy on standing; at one point, he had a little bit of nausea with the dizziness; he was really weak; he didn't eat yesterday because he had no appetite; Chills/Teeth chattering; Shaking; Hot feeling generalized; Sweating; Feeling hot and cold; on Tuesday night (06Apr2021) he didn't sleep well, and he could barely sleep last night (07Apr2021); his head felt heavy on Tuesday night (06Apr2021), and his head felt super heavy last night (07Apr2021); This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient) via a Pfizer-sponsored Program COVAX US Support. A 23-year-old male patient received the second dose of bnt162b2 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Left arm on 27Mar2021 (between 11:55AM and 12:00PM) (Lot Number: ER8732; Expiration Date: Jul2021) as single dose for covid-19 immunisation. The patient medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. The patient previously received the first dose of bnt162b2 via Intramuscular, at the age of 23-year-old, administered in right arm on 06Mar2021 (Lot Number: EN6206, Expiry: 30Jun2021) as single dose for covid-19 immunisation. He felt really terrible yesterday (07Apr2021). On Tuesday night (06Apr2021) he didn't sleep well, and he could barely sleep last night (07Apr2021). His head felt heavy on Tuesday night (06Apr2021), and his head felt super heavy last night (07Apr2021). On 07Apr2021, the patient experienced fatigue, on the left side of his throat, it hurt to swallow/throat pain, really bad headache, sensation of pressure in ear, sensation of pressure in eye, dizzy on standing, a little bit of nausea with the dizziness, really weak, he didn't eat yesterday because he had no appetite, chills/teeth chattering, shaking, hot feeling generalized, sweating, feeling hot and cold. The patient experienced not feeling well on an unspecified date. Patient started developing symptoms that were very bad, he thought he had COVID. Patient had a PCR test that was negative. Patient would like to know if a delayed response after second dose is normal. Reported he had received his second COVID-19 Vaccine dose about 2 weeks ago (27Mar2021). He said he felt really terrible yesterday. He said he felt so bad that he thought he had the COVID-19 Virus, and went to get tested. He clarified he had a real time COVID-19 Virus PCR test yesterday (07Apr2021), and received a negative result today (08Apr2021), less than 24 hours after having the test performed. He said it could be something else that was making him feel terrible. He said he had a (telehealth) appointment with a doctor tomorrow (09Apr2021). Caller asked if Pfizer had any data with the second COVID-19 Vaccine for people that had a really delayed immune response with their immune system. He said he had no symptoms after his second COVID-19 Vaccine, and was wondering if what he was experiencing now was a delayed immune response. Reported last night was the worst for his symptoms, saying it was awful. He said he felt better this morning. He clarified that on Tuesday night (06Apr2021) he didn't sleep well. He said his head felt heavy, but when he woke up, he did not feel too bad. He said he had fatigue, and on the left side of his throat, it hurt to swallow. He said last night (07Apr2021), he had a really bad headache, and his head felt super heavy. He said he had ear and eye pressure. He said he got dizzy on standing, and at one point, had a little bit of nausea with the dizziness. He said he wasn't sure if the nausea was caused by the dizziness. He said he was really weak, and didn't eat yesterday because he had no appetite. He said he took his temperature at around 8:00PM-9:00PM last night, and had no fever. He said he still had his sense of taste and smell. He said he had chills, he was shaking, and his teeth were chattering. He said he was also hot and sweating at times, like he was alternating between hot and cold. He said he tried to drink water yesterday, and would take a few sips of water when he turned over in bed. He said he could barely sleep. Treatment: Reported he took Ibuprofen 200mg tablets, off and on, to treat his headache because his headache was preventing him from sleeping. He said he would take 2 Ibuprofen 200mg tablets at a time. He said he took his first Ibuprofen dose in the middle of the night on Tuesday, and then took 2 more doses of 2 Ibuprofen 200mg tablets last night. He said he did not have the Ibuprofen 200mg tablet NDC, Lot, and Expiration Date because he had taken Ibuprofen from a different Ibuprofen 200mg bottle and put it in the Ibuprofen 200mg he was taking from. Reported he felt he had gained strength back today (08Apr2021) because he had showered this morning, and didn't fall over. He said he was so weak yesterday, even trying to text for his work was bad. He said his headache was a little worse today, and his left-sided throat pain was persisting, but everything else had subsided for now. Caller said he was wondering if what he had experienced was a delayed immune response, or a false negative COVID-19 Virus test, or something else, like Mono. Patient was not feeling well. Did test negative covid. The outcome of the event headache, Swallowing painful and Throat pain was not recovered, other events was recovering. No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information is expected.
23 2021-04-24 vomiting Pt was leaving ballroom after 15 min observation. Pt fainted, went down onto knees, then fell forwar... Read more
Close
Pt was leaving ballroom after 15 min observation. Pt fainted, went down onto knees, then fell forward. Onsite EMTs helped pt into chair after he regained consciousness (15 sec). Pt was helped into w/c, brought to observation area outside ballroom. Pt was awake and able to answer questions, appeared pale and sweaty, stated he felt like he was going to vomit. Denied SOB, stated he felt less lightheaded. Pt then vomited sm amt x 1. Patient denied ever having vasovagal response to injections. Pt stated he had been hungover this morning and had not eaten or drank much today. VS were taken (BP 90/40, HR 80, RR 14). Pt was given water. Pt was observed for an additional 20 min, color visibly improved, pt stated he was feeling better. Pt refused transport to ED for further assessment. EMT suggested calling home for a ride, pt called sister and she agreed to pick him up. VS retaken before pt left, WNL (BP 105/70, BMP 59, SpO2 95). Pt left w/ family after 30 min.

Close
Received first dose of Pfizer on 3/1. Felt tired for few days and was fine. Started having neck and back pain and then extreme heart burn, pain down left arm, trouble breathing etc. Admitted into hospital on 3/20/21 with Triponin Level at 1.8 and Blood Platelets level at 20,000. Fever and resting heart rate of 135 BPM. Extreme heart burn and pain down left arm. Triponin level rose to 4.5. Platelet levels did not increase. After multiple blood tests to make sure they were correct Cardiologist and Hematoligist diagnosed as Myopericarditis and ITP blood disorder. Spent 4 days in hospital on heavy Decadron dose for ITP and levels improved. Myopericarditis being treated with Colchicine and Metoprolol. Was discharged from hospital on 3/24 and monitored at home. ITP levels still fluctuating and Myocarditis and Pericarditis are still being treated. No previous history of any heart or blood problems and no family history. 23 year old healthy male with no previous health conditions.

23 2021-05-14 nausea, abdominal pain upper Sore joints; his butt is still a little sore from falling; dizziness/ light headed; fainting; pain i... Read more
Close
Sore joints; his butt is still a little sore from falling; dizziness/ light headed; fainting; pain in upper abdomen area; Sweating; Nausea; falling; This is spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 23-year-old male patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE) via an unspecified route of administration on 29Apr2021 at 1 pm (around 12:20ish as reported) (Lot Number: FN6206) (at 23-year-old) at single dose in arm right for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient's medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. No history of all previous immunization with the Pfizer vaccine considered as suspect, no additional vaccines administered on same date of the Pfizer suspect, no prior vaccinations within 4 weeks, no family medical history relevant to AEs. The patient stated he is a pretty healthy guy. All day after getting the vaccine he was fine. He got the shot at like 1 came home took a nap, ate some dinner, and was playing XBOX with the boys when this happened. At around 10:30 pm on 29Apr2021 he went to rub, his stomach just above his belly button and it hurt. He said that he read on line that that area is called the pancreas or liver, it has a lot of names for that area when looking online. He stated it's the left upper abdomen area he felt pain when he pressed on it. It radiated really fast across his abdomen while he was on the phone with mother. The more he pressed the more the pain got sharper, and it radiated right across the abdomen, mainly above belly button not too much in lower abdomen, not much in upper abdomen. It was very sensitive. He didn't have to press hard to trigger the pain. It was almost like the area was inflamed. It happened really fast and that it was his upper stomach not so much the lower part of his abdomen. He felt dizziness and nauseous and like a silly boy he tried to run to the bathroom. He stated that he fell and fainted. His butt was still a little sore from falling. He said when he woke up, he was sweating like he had been out side all day. He did not recall sweating any time he fainted in the past. The side effects were gone after about ten minutes. He was really light headed and had the crazy sharp pain in abdomen for about ten minutes and then it was gone. He had never had that kind of pain. He was laying on the floor for a couple minutes. He went to get his phone, and then sat back down and was sweating. He still had pain at that time but it only lasted about 10 minutes at most. He was still a little bit sore in some joints which was not unexpected. He confirmed that he had a little bit of sweating, and he fainted a little bit. Since the episode he hasn't felt any symptoms like that before, he has not had any pain like gastritis but he has had some random gastrointestinal things before. It's also reported nausea on 29Apr2021. No required to emergency room and physician office. He was on the verge of going to the ER while the pain was there. He was going to go until it stopped and to get checked out. No relevant test. The outcome of the events sore joints, dizziness and butt sore was unknown; for other events was resolved on 29Apr2021. No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information is expected.

It was reported, He was diagnosed with ADHD between 2012-2014. He said he took a generic Adderall 20mg Immediate Release tablet, twice a day (20mg in the morning & 20mg at 2:00PM). He said he had been on Adderall for about 8 years. His muscles spasms were from a prior accident he had. He said he was hit by a car going 48mph while he was riding his bicycle. He got the Pfizer BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine shot yesterday (16Mar2021). He said he was not feeling well. He said about 4:00PM yesterday (4-7 hours after getting his Pfizer BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine), he was feeling weird, and it had gotten worse. He said his heart beat was fast, he had high blood pressure, his stomach hurt, he had muscle spasms, he could not sleep, he had diarrhea, a fever, dry eyes, and left upper arm pain. He said he was normally healthy, and did not have the COVID-19 Virus before. He said he wanted to report his symptoms to Pfizer. He had ADHD and high blood pressure. He clarified he took his blood pressure last night and his blood pressure was 160/98. He said he took his blood pressure medication, Zebeta, and his anxiety medicine, Clonazepam, at the same time last night. He said he takes Zebeta (Bisoprolol Fumarate) for his high blood pressure. He said he takes 1/2 of a Zebeta 5mg tablet (2.5mg) once a day, as needed, a few times a week when his blood pressure was high. He said the Zebeta was not like Propranolol. He said his blood pressure was fine. He said the Zebeta also lowered his heart rate. He clarified he takes Zebeta and all his other medications at the same time, and that his heart rate may have been lowered by the Clonazepam he took. He said he takes a Clonazepam 0.5mg tablet twice a day. He said he normally takes 1mg Clonazepam, but can take a Clonazepam 0.5mg tablet, as needed. He stated he had been taking the Clonazepam for as long as Adderall. He said he started taking Adderall first. He clarified he started taking Clonazepam for bad nightmares. He said he had tried all other types of medications for his nightmares. He said he started the Clonazepam in 2014 for his bad nightmares, and now the Clonazepam was prescribed for anxiety and panic attacks. He said he sees a therapist once a week. He said he checked his "pulse ox" last night, and his pulse ox was good. He said his heart rate was up to 120bpm last night. He said he kept a watch on his heart rate, and his heart rate was around 100-110, which was higher than normal. He said his heart rate was still elevated while he was laying down, stating his current heart rate was 113bpm. He said when he exercised his heart rate normally goes up to between 140-160bpm. Clarified he woke up at 4:00AM this morning (17Mar2021) with diarrhea. He said he had bad diarrhea from 4:00AM-5:30AM. He said he ate something for breakfast and took a fiber gummie. He said the fiber gummie would help harden his stool, and he did not want to take anything to cause constipation. He said he had not had diarrhea since about 5:30AM. He provided the fiber gummie product information as: Fiber Well Fit Supplement 5grams fiber. He had a fever. He stated he was going to check his temperature while he was speaking with the Pfizer agent, but did not provide his body temperature. He clarified a weird symptom he experienced after getting the Pfizer BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine was dry eyes. He said his dry eyes started around 12:00PM yesterday (16Mar2021). He said he bought Liquid Tears eye drops that were either (Company name) brand or (Company name) brand. He said the Liquid Tears was a saline eye drop with no medication in it. His stomach started to hurt between 8:30-9:00PM last night. He said he had a normal dinner and had taken his daily medications at 6:00PM yesterday. He was confused, too. He clarified his confusion started at 4:00AM today (17Mar2021). He said he did not charge his phone overnight, which was not normal, and a lot of other weird things. He said he knows it was not his medications causing his confusion because he had not started any new medications. He said he had been taking the same medications for quite some time. He got everyone (his mother and father) signed up for the COVID-19 Vaccine, and he was the only one experiencing issues. He was prescribed Lyrica due to a DUI accident, saying he knows Lyrica was a Pfizer medication. He clarified he was on Gabapentin first. He said he was on the maximum dose of Gabapentin (either 2000mg or 6000mg) in 2016. He said he was then was put on Lyrica. He said the Lyrica did not work as well as the Gabapentin. He clarified the Lyrica 75mg was stronger than the Gabapentin, and he didnot like how tired he was while taking the Lyrica 75mg. He said he took the Lyrica 75mg for a month or 2, and then was put back on Gabapentin. He said he was no longer taking either the Gabapentin or Lyrica. He said it was 6-7 years ago that he had taken Lyrica 75mg. He said he knew beforehand what the COVID-19 Vaccine side effects were, like chills, but diarrhea was not on the list of COVID-19 Vaccine side effects. He was not immunosuppressed. He said he had a septorhinoplasty a year ago. He could not sleep last night. He said he had diarrhea. He said his arm (left) hurts, but he does not care about that. He clarified he had his first Pfizer BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine shot in his left deltoid, and his left upper arm hurt. He said his left upper arm felt worse than getting a tetanus shot. He said he had really sensitive skin, and was white as a ghost. He said he did not have any swelling on his left upper arm and had put ice on his left upper arm earlier. He said he know, and intramuscular shot takes a few hours to get into the blood stream, and he did not know if the Pfizer BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine passed through the blood brain barrier. He had muscle spams last night. He clarified he had the muscle spasms prior to the Pfizer BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine. He said the muscles spasms were from a prior accident he had. He said he took one SOMA (Carisoprodol) last night (16Mar2021), clarifying the Carisoprodol was prescribed for his muscle spasms. He said he was prescribed a low dose of Carisoprodol for his muscle spasms. He said he usually takes Carisoprodol 250mg tablet up to twice a day (250mg at midday & 250mg at night). He said he had been taking Carisoprodol for 3 years. He said he took the 1 Carisoprodol 250mg tablet with the Zebeta (beta blocker) last night and he had no crazy muscle spasms. He said the Carisoprodol was dispensed in a pharmacy bottle and didn't have the NDC, Lot and Expiration Date listed. He had a complete blood panel a few months ago, and everything was fine. He had anxiety, ADHD and insomnia, saying that was why the takes his medications. He stated he did not take his Adderall this morning. He said he takes a generic Adderall 20mg Immediate Release tablet, twice a day (20mg in the morning & 20mg at 2:00PM). He said he had been on Adderall for about 8 years. He said the generic Adderall 20mg Immediate Release tablet was dispensed in a pharmacy bottle and had no NDC, Lot & Expiration Date listed. He does not drink coffee, and wanted to make sure that was noted on the report. He takes an Amitriptyline 50mg tablet at night. He stated he has been taking Amitriptyline 50mg for about 3-4 years. He said the Amitriptyline 50mg was dispensed in a pharmacy bottle, and he does not have the NDC, Lot, and Expiration Date. He said before the Amitriptyline, he used to take a Trintellix 20mg tablet once a day. He said the Trintellix 20mg was made by Takeda and was a terrible anti-depressant. He said he took Trintellix for about a year and a half, and the Trintellix did not do too much, he said the Trintellix was not working. He said the Trintellix gave him terrible constipation and nausea. He said he still had 4 Trintellix manufacturers bottles at his father house. He said the Trintellix 20mg was probably expired, and he had kept the Trintellix 20mg because it cost about $500 a bottle. He could not take SSRIs, like Paxil, Sertraline, and Lexapro. He said the SSRIs caused problems like sexual dysfunction. He said he does not have the NDC Number, Lot Numbers, and Expiration Dates for the SSRIs he used in the past. He said he was still with his pediatrician at the time he was taking SSRIs, and had since thrown out all his SSRI prescription bottles. He had some questions about the ingredients in the Pfizer BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included blood pressure measurement: 160/98 on 16Mar2021 , heart rate:100-110, heart rate:113, heart rate: 140 on an unknown date, heart rate: 120 on 16Mar2021 bpm , complete blood panel: everything was fine on an unknown date, oxygen saturation: good on 16Mar2021. Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of events includes Gabapentin, Carisoprodol, Clonazepam, Zebeta, Adderall. The clinical outcome for events his heart beat was fast and his heart rate was up to 120bpm last night, he had bad diarrhea from 4:00AM-5:30AM, his dry eyes started around 12:00PM yesterday was recovering and outcome for events hypertension, his stomach started to hurt between 8:30-9:00PM last night, Fever ,feeling unwell was unknown while rest of events was not recovered. Description of Product Complaint: He was on Gabapentin, and then was put on Lyrica. He said the Lyrica did not work as well as the Gabapentin. He clarified the Lyrica 75mg was stronger than the Gabapentin, and he did not like how tired he was while taking the Lyrica 75mg. He said he took the Lyrica 75mg for a month or 2, and then was put back on Gabapentin. He said he was no longer taking either the Gabapentin or Lyrica. He said he had taken the Lyrica 75mg 6-7 years ago, and he no longer had the prescription to provide the Lyrica NDC, Lot, and Expiration Dates. He said in 2016 he was on the maximum dose of Gabapentin, and no longer had the Gabapentin NDC, Lot, and Expiration Date. He used to take a Trintellix 20mg tablet before he started taking Amitriptyline 50mg. He stated the Trintellix was a terrible anti-depressant. He said he took Trintellix for about a year and a half, and the Trintellix did not do too much. He said the Trintellix was not working. He said he still had 4 Trintellix manufacturer bottles at his fathers house. He said the Trintellix was probably expired, and he had kept the Trintellix because it cost about $500 a bottle. No follow-up attempts are possible. No further information is expected.

This is a spontaneous report received from a contactable consumer, the patient. A 23-year-old male patient received his first dose of BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Lot number: EP6955) via an unspecified route of administration in the left arm on 19Mar2021 at 08:45 (at the age of 23-years-old), as a single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history was not reported. The patient did not had any allergies to food, medications, or other products. Prior to the vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. Since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested positive for COVID-19. The patient did not receive any other medications within 2 weeks of vaccination. On 19Mar2021 at 13:00, the patient experienced fast heartbeat, slight shortness of breath and nausea. The patient did not receive any treatment for the reported events. The adverse event did not result in a visit to the doctors or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit, and emergency room/department or urgent care. The clinical outcome of the events fast heartbeat, slight shortness of breath and nausea was not recovered at the time of this report. No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information is expected.

A 23-year-old male patient received the first dose of BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Lot Number: UNKNOWN) via unspecified route of administration in the left arm on 04Apr2021 at 13:00 (at the age of 23-years-old) as a single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. The events did not result in doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit, and emergency room/department or urgent care. The patient did not receive any treatment for the events. Close
I got my second pfizer vaccine 0n 1/27/21 at 10 am. I had no reactions at all after the injection was given. I waited for 30 minutes and was perfectly fine. Around 5 pm I started to feel symptoms. I got the worst aches in my entire body i've ever felt before, along with chills. I felt extremely hot, I took my temperature and had a fever of 102.3. I felt dizzy, lightheaded, and nauseas . My head was throbbing. I ended up taking 1000mg of tylenol to help reduce the fever, which seemed to really help. I fell asleep and woke up the next morning drenched in sweat. My fever was gone, but I still had a horrible headache and threw up from the nausea I was having. It felt like I had a horrible hangover.

He was assisted up into a chair . He was given water and crackers. After drinking water and eating the crackers he felt okay enough to leave after 30 minutes. He was walked to the foot where his ride was waiting in the parking lot. He had dinner but had not had his breakfast as at the vaccination time.

24 2021-04-22 nausea Client received vaccine and started to feel lightheaded, dizzy and nauseous. Client exited car for ... Read more
Close
Client received vaccine and started to feel lightheaded, dizzy and nauseous. Client exited car for fresh air and symptoms worsened. Client lowered himself to the ground to prevent falling. Fire Rescue arrived to evaluate patient. Client diaphoretic, pale, but A+Ox3. Vitals all wnl, symptoms began to resolve as client rested and hydrated. Client was able to ambulate independently back to his vehicle where he continued to recover. Client declined transport for further evaluation and stated he felt better. Per Fire Rescue no further evaluation needed at scene. Client released at 10:45am.

20 second post-administration of vaccine, patient stated he felt nauseous, and like he was going to pass out. He was lowered to the floor and did not lose consciousness. 24 2021-04-27 abdominal distension, decreased appetite, abdominal discomfort, nausea, diarrhea, blood in stool Normal reaction the following day, strong fatigue, headache, nausea, arm soreness. Disappeared 36 ho... Read more
Close
Normal reaction the following day, strong fatigue, headache, nausea, arm soreness. Disappeared 36 hours later. 3 days later experienced heavy nausea, anxiety, gastrointestinal discomfort. Heavy bloating, inability to pass gas, loose stool/diarrhea all week. 7 days post vaccination symptoms came back, feeling of wanting to vomit, strong nausea, loss of appetite. 7-14 days later lost majority of appetite, eating aversion, heavy bloating, nausea and continuing diarrhea. Weakness, fatigue and shaking. Received Stool sample and blood test April 13. Elevated levels of albumin and red blood cell count. Doctor said it was most likely from dehydration. Zofran prescribed April 13 and only taken 2 days. Nausea subsided and ability to eat came back slowly. Since April 15th have been eating more food, but still have to force myself to eat. Hunger pangs rarely felt, only know when hungry when stomach churns and fatigue sets in. Today, April 28, still experiencing slight anxiety, loose stools once every other day, brain fog and depression. Lack of emotion, irritability and periodic upset stomach still persist, along with appetite loss. Am able to eat filling meals again, but no appetite makes food less appealing. Failure to thrive still evident and feeling like I won't get better evident. Treatment during illness was minimal, urgent care did nothing other than prescribe zofran. Gastroenterologist and GP cannot see me for another 2 weeks.

24 2021-05-14 nausea Patient stated he felt nauseated and dizzy. When he attempted to stand up to move to the cot, he was... Read more
Close
Patient stated he felt nauseated and dizzy. When he attempted to stand up to move to the cot, he was unable to steady himself and he said he felt shaky, so RN, brought cot to him, and a few Admin staff surrounded him with drapes dividers. He laid on the cot to rest, legs elevated, and he stayed approx 30minutes. He said he was cold and he just felt "off." Today's dose was his second, and he said he had no reaction to the first dose. He said he ate today. He drank an 8oz bottle of water. Cool pack applied to back of his neck. He said he felt nausous,and was unable to sit up after several minutes of laying down on the cot. After some deep breathing exercises, and resting, he began to feel a little better. RN brought his wife into the area from the car where she was waiting. Eventually, he said he was feeling steady enough to sit in a chair. RN's, B and D helped him out of cot and into a folding chair. After a few minutes, he said he still felt "not like himself" and the decision was made to go to the urgent care. RN D and worker assisted patient to the passenger side of the car. 1500: 124/90 P99 T98.3 R16 1515: 120/70 P67 T98.3 POx99% 1530: 120/78 P80 POx 99% R1

24 2021-05-16 diarrhea Headache, chills, sore arm, diarrhea, tiredness
24 2021-05-19 vomiting, nausea 24-year-old male with no prior medical problems presents for evaluation of chest pain. Patient comp... Read more
Close
24-year-old male with no prior medical problems presents for evaluation of chest pain. Patient complains of midsternal chest pain that started approximately an hour ago. He states that it woke him up from sleep. Pain is sharp without any radiation or other associated symptoms including diaphoresis presyncopal symptoms or palpitations. He denies any significant air hunger or shortness of breath. He otherwise had been feeling better after what he tall was post COVID vaccine symptoms. Patient received a 2nd dose of pfizer vaccine 3 days ago. He states that within 24 hours he had symptoms of myalgia fever and feeling unwell. That has been resolving patient has been feeling better until the chest pain today. Patient otherwise denies any other medical problems in. He denies any history of drug use including any recent cocaine or other drug abuse. Elevated cardiac enzymes and chest discomfort are likely secondary to myocarditis and secondary to vaccination/ inflammatory reaction. Although there is low likelihood of obstructive coronary artery disease as well. I recommended cardiac catheterization for clarification. He does not want to have the procedure done, understands the risk of undiagnosed coronary artery disease and risk of MI. He would like to be discharged home. I reviewed the images of echocardiogram and it seems that he has a small area of hypokinesis in infero basal segment. Recommended to take aspirin and be seen in Cardiology office in 2 weeks. Advised to abstain from exercise and significant physical activity till that time and return to the hospital if any symptoms. Subjective: I saw patient in consultation for evaluation of chest pain and elevated cardiac enzymes. Patient is a 24-year-old healthy male who had COVID-19 vaccination with his second Pfizer shot 4/14/21. He developed fever, chills, nausea and vomiting 1 day after vaccination. He did not have any reaction to the 1st dose. He presented to the hospital with substernal chest discomfort which woke him up from sleep, radiated to throat and had a throbbing feeling. This lasted for 1 to 2 hours and subsided completely in the hospital. He smokes 5 cigarettes a day, is physically very active and exercises regularly. He is not on any medication at home.

24 2021-05-21 diarrhea, nausea Started developing chest pain a week after taking the first dose. Progressively worsened since then ... Read more
Close
Started developing chest pain a week after taking the first dose. Progressively worsened since then till present/had bouts of sharp chest pain/CP; X-Ray showed pleural effusion and slight fullness of main pulmonary artery.; pleural effusion; Fatigue/tiredness/High fatigue and tiredness persisted from right after the vaccine till present; diarrhea; tiredness; high fever; chills; nausea; brain fog; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer. A 24-year-old male patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration on 12Apr2021 as 1st dose, single for covid-19 immunisation. The patient medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. The patient started developing chest pain a week after taking the first dose (13Apr2021). Progressively worsened since then till present. At present also have fatigue, diarrhea and tiredness. Yesterday, had bouts of sharp chest pain so got an X-Ray from ED which showed pleural effusion and slight fullness of main pulmonary artery. Doctor stated it was indicative of CP. In the initial few days after the first dose, had high fever, chills, nausea and brain fog. High fatigue and tiredness persisted from right after the vaccine till present. The patient was very healthy and have never had a heart complication before. The timing might be indicative of a causation between the vaccine and the present medical condition. Ae resulted in doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit. There is no other vaccine in four weeks, no other medications in two weeks, no treatment for ae, no covid prior vaccination. The patient tested covid post vaccination (RT-PCR) with Nasal Swab on 03May2021, covid test result was Negative. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. List of any other medications the patient did not receive within 2 weeks of vaccination. The outcome of the events was not resolved. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested.

24 2021-05-25 abdominal pain MYOCARDITIS. I experienced extreme chest pain, tightness, shortness of breath, painful heart beats,... Read more
Close
MYOCARDITIS. I experienced extreme chest pain, tightness, shortness of breath, painful heart beats, I could feel each beat. I hunched over in my bed groom grabbing my abdomen and fell onto my bed and almost passed out from whack I?d assume is lack of oxygen. I could barely breathe for about five minutes and felt relatively severe pain particularly in the right side of my chest. I could feel every muscle, tendon, and artery inflamed, enlarged, and hurting. My chest felt like it filled up with a balloon. Heart rate went up too. I have NEVER EVER felt ANYTHING like this in my LIFE. Not even close. It was a brand new sensation to me first time I?ve ever felt anything like this at all, and very intense and frustrating. Keeping in mind I am in perfect health. I am a body builder with a perfect physique. I work at a high end restaurant and have an extremely good diet. I have a normal sleep and sexual routine, I don?t use any medications whatsoever even Tylenol or ibuprofen. I have no pre existing conditions. I have no history of heart or cardio problems. My family has a history of low blood pressure. I have next to no stress or anxiety in my life. I am 24 years old I work out and run miles, five to six days a week. I don?t use nicotine, tobacco, and I haven?t had a drink of alcohol in ten years (14yrs old). I smoke marijuana on a daily basis. After about ten minutes the incident went down and I was able to breathe a little better but still had pain and tightness in my chest. I have had shortness of breath ever since. This is being written the day after the event about 26 hours later. I ran a mile last night and went to the gym it seemed to help both my breathing and the pain and tightness but it has not fully gone away. I feel my heart straining somehow as I am typing this. One thing to note is I did not want to get vaccinated but was pressured to do so, and before getting it I was very nervous and honestly upset. The woman administering it was not helpful at all and actually mocked my unsureness and was very rude and unprofessional. She didn?t answer any technical questions I had. During my interaction with her between my nerves and her behavior I?m absolutely certain my heart rate was elevated at the time of getting the shot. I have only had one shot. The episode of myocarditis occurred two weeks after my first shot. Two days after my scheduled second shot, which I missed because of work and was going to reschedule before this occurred. I am not going to be getting the second shot. Will be following up with my primary care doctor as soon as possible. Haven?t had time.

Close
Intense Nausea and vomiting; Intense Nausea and vomiting; Dose 1 administration date 06May2021/dose 2 administration date 06May2021; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). This 24-year-old male patient received dose 1 of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 MRNA VACCINE; lot number EW0158) via an unspecified route of administration on 06May2021 at 10:15 (as reported) and dose 2 of BNT162B2 (lot number EW0175) via an unspecified route of administration on 06May2021 at 10:30 (as reported) as single doses in the left arm for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history was not reported. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the vaccine. The patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19 prior to the vaccine. Concomitant medications included aripiprazole (ABILIFY) from an unknown date for an unknown indication. On 07May2021 at 04:30, the patient experienced intense nausea and vomiting, threw up several times in several hours, and trouble holding food down. The patient received treatment with left over ondansetron (ZOFRAN). The outcome of nausea and vomiting was recovered. The outcome of dose 1 and dose 2 on 06May2021 was unknown. It was also reported that since the vaccination the patient had not been tested for COVID-19. No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information is expected.

24 2021-06-14 nausea passed out; feeling dizzy; fell out of his chair on to the ground; B/P 136/90; BGL 148; feeling naus... Read more
Close
passed out; feeling dizzy; fell out of his chair on to the ground; B/P 136/90; BGL 148; feeling nauseous; tingly feeling in arm and chest; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable Hcp. A 24-years-old male patient received bnt162b2 (BNT162B2), dose 1 intramuscular on 31May2021 11:45 (Lot Number: EW0171) at 24-years-old as 1st dose, single for covid-19 immunisation. The patient medical history was not reported. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. On 31May2021, the patient waiting in observation and started feeling dizzy then passed out and fell out of his chair on to the ground. Obtained baseline vitals B/P 136/90, BGL 148, O2 96% pulse 69 PT was alert immediately after falling we gave water and observed further got another set of vitals B/P 120/78 02 started feeling nauseous and called 911. overall felt nauseous and tingly feeling in arm and chest no pain, and passed out. The patient received first aid for events. The outcome of events was recovered on 31May2021.; Sender's Comments: Based on known drug safety profile, there is reasonable possibility of causal association between the events Loss of consciousness, Dizziness, Fall, Blood pressure increased, Blood glucose increased, Nausea, Paraesthesia and the suspect drug BNT162B2. Based on known drug safety profile, there is reasonable possibility of causal association between the event Loss of consciousness, Dizziness, Fall, Blood pressure increased, Blood glucose increased, Nausea and Paresthesia the suspect drug BNT162B2. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to regulatory authorities, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate.

Patient called from work approximately 3 hours post-vaccination with symptoms of chest pain, shortness of breath, vomiting, and UE paresthesias. He proceeded to have a syncopal episode and 911 was called by his co-workers. Pt regained consciousness prior to EMS arriving. He reported feeling nauseated and was found to be hypertensive. He was given Zofran, which helped with his nausea. His blood pressure normalized. Patient felt better and declined any further evaluation or treatment, including declining transfer to ED.

25 2021-03-03 nausea, abdominal pain Within 1-2 minutes I experienced full body tingling; facial numbness; vision became distorted/blurry... Read more
Close
Within 1-2 minutes I experienced full body tingling; facial numbness; vision became distorted/blurry; vision became distorted/blurry; whole body was sweating; abdominal pain; lower extremity aching; nausea; experienced moderate to severe lower back spasms; sciatica; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable other health professional (patient). This 25-year-old male patient received the first dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE) (Lot# ELO739), via intramuscular on 04Feb2021 03:15 at single dose in the left arm for COVID-19 immunization. The patient's medical history included medullary kidney disease, and allergies to iodized contrast and bees (both resulting in anaphylaxis). The patient did not received any other medications within 2 weeks of vaccination. Facility where the most recent COVID-19 vaccine administered was Public Health Clinic/Veterans Administration facility. Patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. Within 1-2 minutes (03:15) patient experienced full body tingling and facial numbness. A minute later his vision became distorted/blurry and he began getting warn. A minute later his whole body was sweating, he was experiencing abdominal pain, lower extremity aching, and nausea. These symptoms other than the sweating persisted for another 5 days. After the 5th day, patient experienced moderate to severe lower back spasms and sciatica that resulted in an urgent care visit and a prescription for muscle relaxers and a mild pain reliever. The muscle spasms have been present for a week now and is slowly getting better. Patient was seen by an orthopedic urgent care where they recommended physical therapy and limited walking/sitting for extended periods of time. The adverse event result in doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit and Emergency room/department or urgent care. Treatment received for the adverse event included diphenhydramine hydrochloride (BENADRYL) (day of vaccination) and muscle relaxers. Prior to vaccination, patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, patient has not been tested for COVID-19. Outcome of whole body was sweating and sciatica was not recovered, outcome of moderate to severe lower back spasms was recovering, outcome of other events was recovered on an unspecified date in Feb2021. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested.; Sender's Comments: Based on event-vaccine chronological association, a causal relationship between reported events and BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE) cannot be excluded. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees and Investigators, as appropriate.

25 2021-04-14 nausea Shortly after receiving vaccination patient had a witnessed syncopal event while in a seated positio... Read more
Close
Shortly after receiving vaccination patient had a witnessed syncopal event while in a seated position. Pt fell forward from the chair sustaining a nasal injury resulting in epistaxis. EMS was called to the scene. Initial VS prior to EMS arrival was: BP138/80, HR 74, RR 16. When EMS arrived patient was moved into a seated position on the floor. Within 1 minute patient stated that they didn't feel well like they were going to pass out again, became nauseous and pale. Patient placed in supine position and repeat VS of BP: 95/53, HR 72 and RR 16. Patient was placed on EMS stretcher and transported to Hospital Emergency Department for further evaluation/treatment. *Of note, patient stated afterwards that he has passed out with prior lab draws/immunizations.*

Shivering, chills, fatigue, nausea started at 11:59 progressing into fever >100F at 9:00 AM the next day. Symptoms mitigated by alternating ibuprofen/acetaminophen, but fever came off and on inverse to chills; felt extremely warm when temperature spiked, felt extremely cold when temperature was normal. Above symptoms completely abated ~72 hours after injection. Tingling sensation in lower backed started 24 hours after dose and persisted for 72 hours thereafter, sensation moved up to neck for another 48 hours afterwards.

25 2021-04-25 vomiting Nurse at clinic incorrectly diluted a Pfizer vaccine vial with 0.8 ml of sodium chloride instead of ... Read more
Close
Nurse at clinic incorrectly diluted a Pfizer vaccine vial with 0.8 ml of sodium chloride instead of 1.8 ml of sodium chloride and administered 0.3 ml to the patient. The patient experienced 104 degree fever with vomiting, dizziness and extreme muscle joint pain. We explained to him that we noticed the dose he was given had been diluted improperly and he had received a slightly higher than normal dose. I apologized for the incident and he said ?it?s ok?, and that now he knew why he was so sick. He was very pleasant and appreciative of us trying to contact him over the weekend. He was encouraged to contact us with any questions or if any new symptoms arise. We also offered to have one of our providers contact him to discuss further, but he declined.

with small amounts of blood in vomit; Pain in right arm; back and head ache; back and head ache; nausea; vomiting; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 25-years-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), via an unspecified route of administration in the right arm on 10Apr2021 at 13:15 (lot number and expiration date: unknown) at a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history was not reported. Concomitant medication included fluoxetine (FLUOXETINE) taken for an unspecified indication, start and stop date were not reported. 25 2021-04-27 abdominal pain upper, blood in stool, colitis Colitis; Blood in stool; Stomach pains; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (pa... Read more
Close
Colitis; Blood in stool; Stomach pains; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 25-years-old male patient received first dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE; lot number and expiry date: unknown), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Right on 22Mar2021 16:30 (25-years-old) as single dose for COVID-19 immunization (to go on vacation). The patient medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. Vaccination facility type was Convention Center. Caller reported that he thinks that he got the first dose on 22Mar2021 and is scheduled to get the second dose on Friday, 16Apr2021. Caller reported that on Monday, 22Mar2021 he got the first dose of the Pfizer Covid-19 vaccine. Caller reported that he went to sleep on 22Mar2021 and woke up starting to feel stomach pains on 23Mar2021. Caller reported that he felt the stomach pains throughout the day on 23Mar2021. Caller reported that he ended up going to the emergency room due to the stomach pains. Caller also reported that while using the bathroom, there was blood in his stool. Caller reported that when he went to the emergency room, he was diagnosed with colitis on 24Mar2021. Caller reported that his discharge paperwork from the emergency room states that colitis can happen from vaccines. Caller reported that the emergency room staff could not rule out the Covid-19 vaccine as the cause of the caller's colitis because the vaccine is so new. Caller reported that he was prescribed antibiotics for the colitis, which helped. Caller reported that the stomach pains stopped in Mar2021 (also reported as about 5 days afterward he got the antibiotics on Wednesday, 24Mar2021). Caller reported that he is no longer experiencing blood in his stool at all. Caller reported that he had blood in his stool on the night of Tuesday, 23Mar2021 and the morning of Wednesday, 24Mar2021. Caller reported that the blood in his stool resolved around 4-5 days after beginning the antibiotics prescribed for his colitis. Caller reported that his colitis resolved completely about 4-5 days after beginning the antibiotics, around Friday 26Mar2021 or Saturday 27Mar2021. Caller reported that he had not been able to find his vaccine card and he did not have anything with the product NDC number, lot number, or expiry date. Caller reported that when he went to the emergency room, the emergency room staff took blood and did a CAT scan on 24Mar2021. Caller reported that he did not know the results of these investigations, but that the emergency room staff said everything looked normal. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included CAT scan: unknown results (everything looked normal) and Unspecified lab work: unknown results on 24Mar2021. The outcome of the events was recovered in Mar2021. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested.

Close
The patient was escorted to the waiting room post vaccine injection. He reported feeling light-headed. He was escorted to the exam room table with the NP and PCT and placed in the supine position. He reports feeling light-headed and nauseous but alert and oriented x 3; BP 102/65, P 65 BPM, RR 16, O2 sat 97-98%. Notified at 1238. The patient was observed by the NP and remained with continuous pulse ox monitoring. At 1309, HOB raised to 30 degrees and patient given sips of water; BP 104/60, P 61 BPM, RR 16, O2 sat 97% RA. He c/o dizziness and nausea with position change, BP 110/75, P 60 BPM, RR 16, O2 sat 98% RA. He remains in the waiting room chair with PCT observation. At 1335, he begins with vomiting x 1 episode. He reports that he feels better and denies dizziness at this time. At 1353 he reports that he is feeling better. Denies dizziness or nausea; BP 104/60, P 65 BPM, RR 18, O2 sat 100% RA. He was discharged at 1410 with his boss from work. He is alert and oriented x 3, denies SOB, dizziness, lightheadedness, or N/V.

25 2021-05-31 nausea Pt is a 25M with PMH of GERD, ADHD, obesity who presented to the ED on 5/11 for chest pain. That mor... Read more
Close
Pt is a 25M with PMH of GERD, ADHD, obesity who presented to the ED on 5/11 for chest pain. That morning he had noticed increased substernal chest pressure associated with palpitations, nausea, diaphoresis, and left arm tingling. He notes that early last year he was very sick and though he had COVID but confirmatory testing was not available at that time. After recovering from the illness he noted that he had occasionally episodes of chest pressure and palpitations. However yesterday was the worst his symptoms have ever been. He did receive his 2nd COVID vaccine this past Saturday and experienced fatigue, nausea, weakness. In the ED patient has HD stable, afebrile, saturating well on RA. Labs were notable for troponin of 5.2 which trend down to 3.1. ESR WNL, CRP elevated 2.4. EKG showed normal sinus rhythm with signs suggestive of possible pericarditis. CXR negative. CTA showed no pulmonary embolism, enlarged and prominent left axillary lymph nodes, nonspecific, cholelithiasis. Patient admitted for NSTEMI. Enlarged axillary lymph nodes likely reactive in the setting of recent COVID vaccine. Cardiology consulted. Patient underwent cardiac cath which was unremarkable. Cardiology recommends short course NSAIDs for possible pericarditis, however EKG changes unimpressive per cardiology. Discharged home on ibuprofen 400 mg TID for 5 days. Advise follow up with PCP within 1 week.

I have not been able to go to work since the vaccination and have people helping take care of me. I cannot take a shower without being short of breath after. I have been put on 2 different rounds of steroids - the 2nd more aggressive, which did not make a difference. I have been to my general doctor several times, an allergist and a neurologist. I had no previous health problems. Symptoms had not improved in the past 3-4 weeks. Patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. After 5 minutes getting the first dose of Pfizer COVID-19 vaccines I fainted at the pharmacy. The ambulance was called and I was checked in place. ever since I got the vaccine I started feeling my heart rhythm changed, either my heart is slowing down or it beats really fast or get a discomfort feeling in heart and get the feeling of passing out again. This made me loose my appetite to eat for several days. On two instances, i went to the emergency room. I've been following up with my doctor about this issue. The discomfort will happen every several days. Before getting the vaccine I had none of the symptoms.
25 2021-07-15 diarrhea with profuse bleeding, abdominal pain lower Developed profuse bloody diarrhea and lower abdominal pain beginning ten days after vaccination on 4... Read more
Close
Developed profuse bloody diarrhea and lower abdominal pain beginning ten days after vaccination on 4/17. Went to see Dr who performed lab work and stool tests that all came back negative (4/19). Was treated with Zithromax but had no resolution to his symptoms. No family history or prior history of IBD. It seems the onset of disease is clearly temporaly related to the timing of his Pfizer vaccine.
25 2021-07-27 nausea severe headache; nausea; chills; body aches; body aches/joint pain; dizziness; This is a spontaneous... Read more
Close
severe headache; nausea; chills; body aches; body aches/joint pain; dizziness; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer, the patient. A 25-year-old male patient received the second dose of BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Lot Number: EWo150) via an unspecified route of administration in the left arm on 02Apr2021 at 14:45 (at the age of 25-years-old), as a single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included irritable bowel syndrome (IBS). The patient received unspecified medications within 2 weeks of vaccination. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within four weeks prior to the vaccination. The patient previously took BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Lot Number: EN6199) via an unspecified route of administration in the left arm on 06Mar2021 at 12:30 (at the age of 25-years-old), as a single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Prior to the vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19. The patient had no known allergies to medications, food or other products. On 03Apr2021, side effects took place approximately 12 hours after injection at 03:00, the patient experienced severe headache, nausea, chills, body aches/joint pain and dizziness. The events did not result in doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit, and emergency room/department or urgent care. Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of severe headache, nausea, chills, body aches/joint pain and dizziness and included treatment with acetaminophen, 1000mg every 12 hours for 36 hours. The clinical outcome of the events headache, nausea, chills, body aches/joint pain and dizziness was recovered on an unknown date of Apr2021. No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information is expected.
25 2021-07-29 abdominal discomfort This is a spontaneous report from a contactable pharmacist. A 25-year-old male patient received the ... Read more
Close
This is a spontaneous report from a contactable pharmacist. A 25-year-old male patient received the second dose of BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Lot Number: UNKNOWN) via intramuscular route of administration on 16Apr2021(at the age of 25-years-old) as a single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included lupus and asthma. Concomitant medications were not reported. The patient previously received first dose of BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Lot number: UNKNOWN) via intramuscular route of administration on 26Mar2021 as a single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Prior to the vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19. It was unknown if the patient received any other vaccines within four weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. On 16Apr2021, the patient experienced bad fatigue, migraine headache, muscle pain, joint pain, body aches and upset stomach. The events did not result in a visit to the doctors or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit, and emergency room/department or urgent care. The clinical outcome of the event fatigue, migraine headache, muscle, joint pain, body aches and upset stomach was recovered on any unknown date in 2021. No follow-up attempts are needed; information about lot/batch number cannot be obtained.
25 2021-07-29 abdominal discomfort Bad fatigue; migraine headache; muscle and joint pain; muscle and joint pain; body aches; upset stom... Read more
Close
Bad fatigue; migraine headache; muscle and joint pain; muscle and joint pain; body aches; upset stomach; fever; chills; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable pharmacist. A 25-year-old male patient received the second dose of BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Lot Number: UNKNOWN) via an intramuscular route of administration on 16Apr2021 (at the age of 25-years-old) as a single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. The patient previously received BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Lot Number: UNKNOWN) via an intramuscular route of administration on 26Mar2021 (at the age of 25-years-old), as a single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. It was unknown if the patient received any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. Prior to the vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19. On 16Apr2021, the patient experienced bad fatigue, migraine headache, muscle and joint pain, body aches, upset stomach, fever and chills. The clinical outcome of the events bad fatigue, migraine headache, muscle and joint pain, body aches, upset stomach, fever and chills was recovered on an unknown date in 2021. No follow-up attempts are needed; information about lot/batch number cannot be obtained.
